title: Great if and when it works. Zero support if it doesn't
text:
Loved my nest thermostat app for a whole week. Since my nest is in a room we rarely walk through it loves to turn itself off and I either have to check on it every 2 hours or wait until the house is stifiling hot or freezing cold to realize it has gone 5-8 degrees off the temperature I had it set at.
The app solves all of this! Granted I have to log in on my phone every 2 hours, but it actually keeps my house more on track. 
That was until it logged me out and as many times as I have tried to log in then requested a new password when the log in doesn't work, the email never comes and there is not a support option in the app if it won't log you back in. 
So awesome first week and now completely useless. 
I may be better off chucking the whole Nest and just getting a thermostat that actually keeps the house a steady temperature.

title: Great Temperature Accuracy
text:
Admittedly I purchased the Nest Thermostat so I could be even more lazy and set the temperature without leaving the bed.  However, the accuracy of the temperature has made a huge difference in the comfort level of my house.  My old thermostat was all over the board and I would need to manually adjust the temperature throughout the day.  Since installing the Nest Thermostat the temperature is consistent all day and rarely needs adjustment.

Negative:  I had to have an HVAC professional install it because it was a proprietary system.  It only cost me $60 but I wasn’t expecting it to cost anything.  I still gave it 5 stars because I believe it will payoff with lower electricity bills.

title: Good quality. Needs to work on event recognition
text: Picture and sound quality are good. System and monitoring are expensive but it can be used without recording/archiving. Automatic event recognition is fair. It picks up most things, but sometimes a car can pull into my driveway with the headlights at night and it does not register as an event. This is annoying but not critical. Needs a strong internet signal or it will go offline. I would like to have more of them but the annual recording fee is so expensive it is cost prohibitive and there appears to be no way to record with my own equipment. Overall a good system, but clearly designed to hook you in to a system of recurring fees if you want anything beyond basic camera viewing.

title: Used to work good
text: I used to get alerts when my camera spotted someone. Now I don’t get anything. I’ve checked the alert settings and the alerts are set to pop up when a person is spotted but I haven’t gotten alerts in a few weeks now. I don’t get alerts about packages left anymore either. Not a single alert for anything. I have no idea what changed to where I no longer get alerts. We have porch pirates who come through the neighborhood behind ups and fedex so I prefer to get alerts when packages are left so I can get them immediately. I’d be very upset if I ended up being one of the many people who gets a package stolen when I am home most of the time to get my packages but don’t get any type of alert to tell me anything. Please come up with an update to fix this.

title: Worst App By Major Tech Company
text: I expect a pretty high bar for a company as innovative and with the resources of Google. That makes their faulty Nest app a major disappointment and an embarrassing display of brain dead user interface and experience. Every task except raising or lowering your thermostat’s temperature is a gargantuan chore, made even more problematic by an interface best described as bipolar. Adding devices and updating WiFi passwords is especially cumbersome. The app also gets very little attention in terms of updates or fixes. This is all a shame as the hardware, including Nest Thermostat, Protect and Hello, are all generally good. But dealing with this clumsy app negates any good feelings for those devices. Google needs to throw this app in the garbage pail and start again with one fully focused on the user. Maybe they should actually try it themselves and see what a wreck it is - I can’t imagine they’d want to actually torture themselves though!

title: A very convenient system !
text: As a retired person on disability who travels to see her family, there has been nothing more convenient than being able to control my home temperature settings by using my cell phone. Even if the power goes out, I am alerted. This simple system has saved me so much money as a result. The convenience of turning on my system for my return arrivals, adjusting the temperature when I’m stuck in bed and being able to easily create a running schedule that can vary from day to day are also more perks to owning the Nest. Next to my Ring doorbell and security system, the Nest has been one of my best easily affordable electronic purchases.

title: Close out of the app and double check that your changes were saved
text:
I love my nest thermostat, but the app gives me issues often. In the morning, I will turn the air up from my phone. In the middle of the day I will check the temp and realize the temperature never changed from when I adjusted it on the app. Therefore, I just wasted so much money.
Also, the scheduled temperatures give me problems. I will set my desired temperatures but they will not save. It takes me 3 to 4 times of changing the temperatures over and over, even if I “copy and paste” the times in the schedule before it finally stays.
If you do change your temperature or make a schedule from the app, make sure you close out completely from the app and double check to make sure the changes saved.

title: Need to be able to determine each AC cycle time
text: The Neat thermostat is an excellent device. It works, but only on a cumulative basis. If you are able to determine the total number hours used for cooling or heating, why not provide the minutes/time used for each cycle? Telling me I used 10 hours of energy today and showing a chart of the approximate periods when the AC was on and off and not showing the minutes for each cycle defeats the purpose. My request is add the minutes to each cycle and the app will be more informative and intuitive. Don’t just tell us hours used. R&D please tell us the minutes in each cycle. We need granular time not just the total hours used for a particular day. Please! Please!

title: Nest was great! Now, not so much
text:
When we first purchased our net cameras worked great. After about one year of working great, we decided to add more cameras and a thermostat. Since the additions, we have been disappointed. The cameras give constant notifications but NO notification when a thief entered our cars parked next to a camera. It was clearly audible but no notification. However, that same night we got multiple notifications of a “dog barking” when in fact it was a train horn in the distance. Virtually useless for home security. 

Additionally, the face recognition is useless as well. Saved faces are not recognized and faces are pulled from shapes in tree branches. 

As far as the thermostat... it takes on a mind of its own. The user interface is not friendly and difficult to program. 

Since google took over, you have to have a google home account setup to use some of the device features. This means two apps to access all the features. There is now one place to access all of the features. I can’t stress the frustration when you have to jump between the nest app, google home app and the website to manipulate the devices. 1 out of 10, do not recommend!

I’m not sure what the other options are, but I would check them out before I invested in the Nest line of products.

title: Overall, happy! But this google nonsense...
text: I love nest. I have two of their indoor cameras and hope to continue buying more of their products. I have had one camera for over three years now, and just bought a second last year - give or take. Overall, very happy. Overall, would recommend. My ONLY issue is recently, since having to sign in with google, my camera has had more feed issues than ever. I have to click the “try again” button more times in the past month then in my entire 3+ years. Coincidental timing or something with signing into google account? Unsure. Anyone else having this issue? Just curious. Thanks!

title: Saves Money—Sometimes At Expense of Comfort
text:
We have been using Nest for several years now, and on the whole are very happy with it. 
I am not really a fan of the seasonal adjustment periods, though. Twice a year, it goes into “learn” mode to update its programming to stay in sync with your preferences and to identify possible efficiencies. Thing is, it just seems to turn up your settings by a degree if you’re cooling, and down by a degree if you’re heating. Even if you override the new settings, it doesn’t learn and sets *its* preferences at the end of the adjustment period. I have to reset my temperature schedule manually, or accept its setting of 80 degrees right now (August). That feature definitely needs tweaking. Five stars without it.

title: Clunky
text: Very clunky user interface. Company clearly thinks they don’t have customers over the age of 40. All the real estate available on the screen and the graphic to modify the schedule uses about 25%. With it that small, getting the stupid little slider on the temp you want if you have fingernails or fat fingers is an exercise in frustration. I get messages months after they are sent because a copy isn’t also sent to my email. I get a message about seasonal savings but there isn’t anywhere that I can find to turn it off. If this nest was not left by the previous owner, you could not pay me enough to install one. System constantly shuts off completely because the connections in the thermostat aren’t done properly and they keep corroding. If you’re not handy, expect to spend some money on service calls.

title: Ease of control
text:
My wife and I bought a new home this passed July (~3000sqft) and we made the choice to update to the Nest thermostat. 

We have zoned air and needed two for our single level home. After SOME comfort and familiarity of the Nest and the iPhone app, we bought the lock for our back door that we can remotely control from our phones!

The Nest quickly found our routine and adapted to our schedule. The best thing I can say is how easy it was for us to lock the back door (remotely) if we forgot when we left the house and the App noticed we were gone, and we could easily adjust our comfort without running down the hall to the Nest control!

title: Google Ruined a Great Camera System
text:
My wife and I invested in 4 nest cameras, 2 thermostats, and 2 nest smoke detectors.
We loved Nest. Google had us migrate our Nest Account to their Google Account after they purchased Nest (stating it would be more secure). Now our Nest app on the Apple TV won’t work because it STILL doesn’t support the Google Accounts — that Google advised us to migrate to. What’s worse, they know about the problem, and after several months have done NOTHING. You can’t undo the migration and they won’t update the Apple TV app. Making our video cameras worthless. To top it off, we use to be able to use our iPads using a Nest iPad app. They ruined that also, because we now have older models (only 4 years old) which can’t update to the newest iOS and Google released an app that isn’t compatible with older iOS versions. I used to like Google but they destroyed an amazing Nest product line!!

title: Constant app disconnect issues
text:
While I love my thermostats and how much they’ve saved us in energy costs, I would love them more if the app would function correctly. 

Most of the time if I open the app it says “there is a problem connecting to the nest service. Try again in a few minutes.” So I wait, try again, and it works for a few seconds... then back to the error. Take it off WiFi and use cellular in case that’s the problem, again works for a minute, then back to the error. 

I can eventually get done what I need to after a back and forth with the try again button, but I was hoping this would be fixed soon. It’s been a couple months and still having the issue. We wanted to get the nest hello doorbell soon, but I’m worried the app will make that a headache too. I’m not sure how reviewing camera footage would work if it’s kicking me out every few seconds.

title: Granny Cam
text: We got these and installed 3 of them in my 88 yr old mother’s home so we can keep an eye on her. Best “peace of mind” gadget ever! Before if she didn’t answer the phone, I’d panic thinking she had fallen, but now if she doesn’t answer, I check the cameras to see what she’s doing. I can even talk to her through them but she is very hard of hearing so I still just call her. My brother and I both have the app on our phones so we both can check on her any time. My phone sends me notifications so I know when she gets up in the mornings so I don’t even have to check the camera’s. Best thing we could have done so we can rest easy knowing she is alright. Worth every penny!

title: A bit too complicated but yet can’t control what I want to control
text: Maybe I’m just not getting it but the app is a bit difficult to use. I’d love to have more control over timing of temperatures. For instance I’d like my bedroom and bath to be warm when I get up. I keep the temp cool at night but don’t want to get up to a cold room and wait 20 minutes for it to warm. Ok so where do I set it at 73 to be there at 7 am? Who knows? The preheat etc area talks about a 5 hour (default) preheat time, wait what?  I’ve given up trying to figure it out. I bet there is a simple answer but can’t find it in the app. There are a lot of features but they seem to be more bells and whistles than really all that helpful in controlling temperatures.

title: Login & notification issues
text:
Logging in to the app is a pain every time. The app never recognizes my Nest credentials (even after resetting them multiple times) and when I try to login with my Google account, the app freezes. The only time this experience is seamless is when I’m home, which isn’t helpful at all. I don’t need to see what’s going on in my apartment when I’m home. I can see with my own eyes. 

Notifications are also an annoyance. This app sends me push notifications ALL THE TIME. I have notifications turned off when I’m home, yet I still get about 20 notifications when I am home saying it detected movement. Of course you did, it’s me! I’m home! You should know this.

This app is proving to be more of a pain than helpful. GET IT TOGETHER GOOGLE! I never had issues with my Nest products before Google acquired them.

title: So many problems, no solutions.
text: Google has done nothing to make sure this app is functioning. Every time I try to open the app when receiving a notification that some one may be at the door, It takes for ever to open, logs me out, and/or crashes. Every time I get home and try to open the door with the app it logs me out because it tries to connect to the wifi. I always get to the door with before the app is properly open and signed me back in. It’s pretty useless when it comes to camera response connectivity and basic function. The only thing it does right is turn my ac on when I arrive. Other than that everything else just works poorly. I should be able to see footage of my Canera as soon as I click on the notifications. There’s no reason fir it to log me off or open to communicate with carriers before they’re gone. It’s very poor management.

title: Location issues: going into away mode when I’m home
text: Bought a nest about six months ago and it was pretty good at first. Loved the new look and style in the house and it was working just fine. Then the home/away mode starting messing up. After going through the troubleshooting, making sure the address was correct in the nest app for both my wife and myself, deleting it from the home app because that can cause issues as well, and doing a complete reset of the devic and reconnecting it to the Wi-Fi; it still wants to go into eco mode at 7:30 AM because it says we aren’t home, which drops the temperature to 61 degrees in our room. So now I have completely shut off the home/away mode and just manually turn the temp up and down when I need to, which is not why I got this thermostat. Started out great, but now I would not recommend this item to anyone.

title: App and billing issue with Nest
text: App has problem all the time and billing issue is the worse. I end up cancel my subscription because Nest  charge me 2 time 1 year subscription fee plus charge me monthly subscription fee twice every month. I asked for refund and they don’t have any billing records. I showed them the charges from my credit card statement and also from their limited billing tracking records but they still not able to refund me because somehow they cannot find the records. Not sure why. Anyway, I cancel my subscription and changed from nest to google account so I hopefully will not be an issues in billing in the future.

title: Worst smart thermostat
text:
I have run this thermostat for two years now so what I say has good basis in fact and experience.  

There are two things I hate about this thermostat that ruin everything good about it.  First is that I have a new house with a high thermal rating.  I need to be able to decrease the deadband (the swing between turning on and off) on the thermostat to allow it to run to a smaller increase and decrease in temperature.  I can’t, it’s a feature they lock you out of.  So my home swings 5+ degrees over and over both winter and summer.  Too hot then too cold.  I hate it, causes arguments i the house and no way to change it.  On any other thermostat it’s a simpler change.  

The second nasty thing is that twice a year Nest automatically adjusts your temperature settings to what they think it should be instead of what you set it to.  It’s either a few degrees up or a few degrees down depending on the season.  Compounded with the above deadband issue it makes our home intolerable.  You have to go back in and change everything each time they preemptively change it for the season.  There isn’t anyway to stop this apparently.  

I hate to spend that money all over again but I am replacing it with an Ecobee soon.  Both of those issues are solvable with the Ecobee.

title: Integration is awesome. Video performance awful.
text:
I rarely write app reviews. But at this point I feel compelled to let the Nest app team know that all is not well and customers want you to do better. 

We’ll bought into the Nest brand and have Protect smoke & CO detectors throughout the house, 2 outdoor NestCams, and Nest doorbell. Having one app to access and manage all of them is awesome. 

Alerts from NestCams and the Aware service we pay for are valuable. Especially with the number of package deliveries we get and the need for a watchful eye during covid due to increasing petty theft. 

That’s where the problems begin. Alerts are great but the Nest app startup is very long. Then once I select a camera to view live or recorded video, the wait is ridiculous. I could be waiting a minute before video buffers and a live stream or recording is viewable. If it from the doorbell ringing, our visitor may have already left before I can see them and respond! If it’s a package delivery requiring g signature, that makes it even worse!!!

I have an iPhone X with tons of memory. I have super fast wifi (getting up to 300kbps to my phone with low ping). No way it should be this slow - it’s NOT ok.

title: Super slow
text: I have six Nest cameras setup and running. The cameras are very slick and setup is easy, but the app is very slow to open/connect to them via the Internet. This is my biggest complaint. Also, I didn’t realize if my neighborhood loses power, we also lose Internet and all cameras are useless. Bad guys don’t need to kill the power to blind you, just cut your cable or fiber line. Also, don’t make any changes to your network, you will be running the entire network setup wizard again on each device. No manual tweaks of those settings are allowed. So, highly recommend taking a clear pic of each device’s serial number/code before mounting or you’ll be dragging the ladder back out again.

title: Love the Cameras...
text: But the app could make it easier to cast or sling video to any smart tv like the ROKU with just the mirror or cast option. The quality of the camera image is impeccable and the ability to zoom and capture video is awesome. The integration with google has made it somewhat confusing between Google Home App and the Nest App, why have both? And why require other google products to operate my cameras to a larger screen when I already have a smart tv. I don’t need a smarter tv. It would also be nice to be able to change the WIFI password in the app versus getting out the ladder and scanning in each camera individually around my house. I changed my WiFi password a week ago, and I haven’t even bothered updating my cameras because it’s been cold outside.

title: Great app with room to be greater!
text:
I enjoy the Nest app and it’s functionality. I am able to do and complete connected device adjustments at most given time. The only thing that would make this app better is for it to not have long connectivity issues and random syncing errors. I automatically assumed it was an internet connection error, my wifi was tested and all came out as it should. But I noticed the app would sign itself out randomly and when going between the doorbell to thermostat at times the app would glitch and I would have to restart it a few times. 

Other than what I  mentioned, I like the app!

title: Great app, great service, buy a Nest!
text: You naturally hesitate nowadays before buying any electronic device, and let’s admit, reviews can sometimes be biased. I have been a Nest thermostat owner for 33 months and it has taken this long before I decided to write a review before all of my feedback can be interpreted as “worthy”. I felt the urge to write a review because how impressed I have been with my thermostat. All the claims that Nest has made within their descriptions and claims to provide quality products and support have proved worthy to receive a 5 Star review. Buy a Nest thermostat, if it’s able to fit your needs, and my review will deem truthful. You will not be disappointed.

title: Severe Stability Issues
text: I love Nest. I’ve used them for a couple years now and have tried every other ecosystems competing product, and nothing comes close to what Nest can offer. However, on iPhone and iPad in particular, the app has severe issues. One being overall stability, which crashes all the time. It might be due to some sort of battery drain causes by some sort of video codec being used, but it makes my phone white hot within seconds, then crashes. This doesn’t happen at all on my Pixel devices, and runs smoothly constantly without any heating or battery drain issues whatsoever. I would gladly stick with this app, but it’s one of those things where you need these systems to work as much as possible without issue, and I’m sad to say that the issues with Nest on iOS are pretty hardcore.

title: Gorgeous GARBAGE.
text:
A completely unstable system. The hardware looks cool, that’s it. I update, I am in spec, I reload it, nothing changes. It literally crashes every 3 to 5 seconds regardless of what I’m attempting to do in the app. The door camera is also useless. It will tell me there was someone at the door and send me a pic of the edge of someone’s back or completely miss them altogether. you just get whatever useless screen shot they decide to send. I guess that is supposed to encourage you to upgrade to their monthly paid memory service?
We don’t keep a clockwork schedule so we turn down the thermostat when we go to bed. Often (but of course, inconsistently!) the thermostat switches into eco mode and we wake up freezing when it’s decided to lower the temp another 5 degrees while we’re sleeping! Thanks, you sadistic creepy robot! 
Sooooo disappointed in this whole complete garbage system.

title: Updates break functionality
text: Home/Away assist used to work great but in one of the recent updates it stopped working. Shows the phones as away or home correctly but Nest stays at the wrong setting.  Other geofencing apps work fine, it’s a bug that’s been introduced from poor regression testing. No, Google/Nest, I’m not going through reinstalling on a hope that will work like you’ve told some people to do; you don’t know if or why that would work so get some engineers doing some testing and release a patch. Bonus points if instead of “bug fixes” as your update, be brave and list that you “fixed an issue where Home/Away Assist may not work as expected”. It doesn’t build trust to release an update where you’re too embarrassed to detail what bugs you fixed. Your Product managers should be embarrassed to have so few new features and so many defects.

title: Very poor app, filtering is terrible & super slow playback
text: Doorbell hardware is fine though a little slow to respond, but pretty easy to install. The app though is another story, creating zones etc is fine but when it comes to viewing events the filtering simply doesn’t work. What am I most likely to want to do with this type of app ? See who was on my property while I was away. It should be easy to simply select the person filter and perhaps exclude a couple of unnecessary zones and bingo just see the events with persons spotted in those zones, but no, the filtering does literally nothing. I tell it to exclude motion and sounds since the larger area has a lot of movement and noise and otherwise I’ll be scrolling through those events for hours. But as I click done from deselecting them on the filter, all of those events are still there. Truly terrible programming.

title: Latest version buggy, doesn’t work as well
text: We’ve had nest systems for two years and it was working great.  It seems like ever since the transition that happened after being purchased from google there have been issues.  It takes a long time to access the camera after the doorbell rings.  The app constantly says “there was a problem connecting to nest service.”  My schedule for one of the thermostats keeps getting modified and regressing what I think was our pre-COVID schedule.  The front door camera will capture every headlight going by but doesn’t register the person opening our car in the middle of the night to go through our stuff.  I don’t know what’s happened but it’s not working as well as it used to.

title: Subscription needed for video recordings
text:
The app is not the worst... I guess. But some design decisions are puzzling. The scheduling interface for the thermostat is so awful I’d rather just get up and make adjustments manually all the time than bother with that mess.
My biggest complaint about Nest is that you have to pay a subscription to see any recordings made by your cameras. So google records them, has them, but you have to pay a subscription to see them. You can watch live video but if it was 30 seconds ago, out of luck. Feels super shady to me. Pretty sure I’m going to eventually swap the cameras out for a different brand.
If I had to say anything good about these things it would be... well, the app and the hardware works, I guess. I think ‘functional’ is a pretty low bar, but there are worse brands out there.

title: Nest Cam Slow, Misses Events, needs App log in More Often
text:
Something is going on with Nest Cam. Not as good as it used to be. 
Buffering often. I have Gig Fiber service and 4 Nest Cams. 
Lately Nest Cam keeps dropping out log in on the App. Several times I had a motion event then I quickly went to open App to view. Well it required I go through the cumbersome Google login procedure Again then security log in alert emails start after log in. This been happening more often recently. 
Also it’s been missing more events even when there has been no activity for hours. For example Nest Cam never alerted me of a postal delivery right in from of cam. This particular cam location is not in an area with much activity. I could scroll back and find delivery but this is cumbersome. 
In real-time cam view activity is lagging more than it used too. Used to be just seconds behind activity. Now running minutes. 
Had Nest Cams since 2014 and find the service slowly degrading since Google acquisition of Nest. 
Time to move on to other systems.

title: Very inconsistent connection
text: We’ve been suing the Nest for years and daily, when we use the app to communicate with our kids in the other room the app restarts. We get kicked out and have to go back into the app. At first we thought it was a connection issue, but it really doesn’t matter where we are in the house because it consistently has this problem. It makes using the app very annoying. Also, there is a several second delay from when you speak into the app and when the other person can start communicating in return. This makes it difficult with kids who want to respond right away, but they have to wait 3+ seconds to be able to start responding. I wish the system were better overall and the app would see some significant improvements.

title: No communication
text:
I have a Nest-E and the app won’t communicate with the device or if it does it’ll be only for a while. I could set the temperature to 70 degrees and the device would show 78.  Is it the app, the device or a software issue but it simply doesn’t work as its supposed to. Another issue is that it takes a long time for the unit to turn on, usually I have to turn on the A/C manually because the thermostat won’t turn it on, I have deleted and cleared all schedules trying to fix the problem but it still doesn’t work properly.
The Nest-E is a good device, but the software that operates it doesn’t get the job done.

title: Personal information,
text: I’m only sorry I did not read and heed the wisdom of theses ratings before I bought the Nest Thermostat.  I have it but have not installed it.  I started to but then the information asked for to operate the device using the web got out of hand and I know not necessary.  I do wonder where this personal information is going and who will use it.  Since it is not necessary, it’s clear that collecting it must be intended for nefarious purposes.   So I now have a device that will monitor temperatures set and develop a program.  However I will be giving up the ability to turn the fan on without having a temperature set in which means if I want to open all the windows on a cool day I have to set the temperature below to keep the heater from turning on.  It seems I will be giving up a lot from my manually programable device I have now.  I may return it.

title: Works fine
text: I’ve had two cameras for years (4-5yrs). They work well, overall. The picture is clear enough, but it’s not at all like watching HD tv. Occasionally we have issues with freezing images, sometimes the mic will not work when using the app or the person on the other side can barely hear us. There’s a delay with the talk feature, so once you click the button to stop talking the other person starts talking but you may miss part of the conversation. I like the zoom feature, though it’s not very clear. You can still make things out for the most part.  It’s a decent camera and I like that I can go back and see select still images. I like that I can monitor my home from my phone or computer.

title: App keeps signing out
text:
Update, it’s even worse! Not only does it sign out all of the time but the microphone two-way-talk never works properly. Such a useless app. 
Leave it to google to mess up a perfectly good product. You said it was a glitch you were working on over a year ago. You ever going to fix it?

I’ve asked google for help in fixing it. They said it was just a random glitch and it wouldn’t happen again. They then said they fixed it in an update. They then said they again fixed it in an update. The app still signs out randomly and it’s annoying. Never had this issue before it was google! Nest also worked on my Apple TV. You really in that much of a fight with apple that you had to pull a solidly functional and useful feature. No wonder people switch to Ring even though it’s camera quality isn’t comparable.

title: Door bell won’t ring inside of house.
text: It alerts me of every move of a bug, every light changing, and every sound. I will end up with over 700 notifications in a day. I reset the nest doorbell and fixed it so it would chime inside the home but almost immediately after I fixed the problem, the camera went off line and it will no longer chime inside the home. I have chosen the option on the app to ring inside but it’s still not working. It’s very frustrating and I can’t find info on troubleshooting it. Our inside doorbell is set up just like the diagram in the instructions. I like the best but it’s inconvenient to only have a doorbell that rings on the phone only.

title: Come on nest Get your act together
text: I’m getting really agitated with the nest thermostat here they can’t lately for the past two weeks maybe a month it will not stay at the temperature I wanted to stay at yeah drops in the by the morning to about 70° when it’s like 50 outside and when I try to turn up the heat they don’t have it on the app is down I’m so over it I spent $200 on this piece of crap I am so sick and tired of it I wanted something easy that I could use that I wouldn’t have to walk all the way downstairs in the middle of the nightTo turn up my heat it’s been a Flippin nightmare with this device but I don’t want to spend another hundred something dollars on somebody else I wish they would just get their abs situated so people who use it 90% of the time with their phone don’t have to freeze at night

title: Great product but for...
text:
The Nest Thermostats are great products on many levels (install, tech, etc.). The one issue, which is incredibly important, it an inability to set the warning temp (ie if your house temp falls below its sends an alert) higher than 45 degrees F. In many part of the US, if the internal temp of your house drops to 45 degrees you are potentially looking at a serious issue with frozen pipes etc. Many State level weather bureaus recommend not letting home temps in the northern parts of the country fall below 60 or 55 degrees. 

Nest is aware of this but has apparently, to my knowledge, been unable or simply unwilling to address this problem with a software update.

title: Nest Thermostat
text:
The Nest works well but has some annoying quirks. 
1. It will decide you are away even though you and your phone are in the house every day and you didn’t tell it you would be away. You will only discover it has decided you are away when you check your app, because you are sweating or freezing with temperatures in the 80’s in summer or in the 50’s in winter.
2. Today it is in the 90’s outside and I felt a bit hot and looked at the Nest thermostat to see what temperature it was inside. Instead of displaying the temperature it showed an image of a white leaf sitting on a yellow gear (like the “Settings” icon). There is nothing in the app about this icon. I’m still trying to figure out what is wrong or what I’m supposed to do about it.

title: Great app when it works. Does not accurately send notifications and has lag issues.
text:
This app is great when it works but there are flaws with simple things like zone notifications and major lag issues trying to connect to cameras. It happens way too frequently for me. It’s not my WiFi either, I have a few google Wifi pucks in my small house and my WiFi mesh connectivity is excellent. 
I also have 3 Ring cameras in my house as well and their zone notifications are way more accurate and have a lot less lag issues when connecting.

I hope nest can step it up soon. I pay monthly for 3 Nest cameras in my house.

title: Safe
text: As an older adult who is frequently alone at home, my younger son gave me a Nest recently.  I do the majority of my shopping on the internet, especially with the COVID 19 Virus disrupting everyone’s life, so I have a lot of packages being delivered.  This means a lot of strangers at my front door.  My Nest affords me a level of security I haven’t had before and it’s WONDERFUL!!   Not only was the Nest very easy to install, it works incredibly well!!   I am not only able to see who’s at my door, it allows me to talk to that person. title: Can I give 6 ?

title: Peace of Mind with Control
text: I love our Nest thermostats. We have a beach home that we go to periodically during the year and keep heated all year long. Winters can be concerning because one never knows if the power has gone out creating the potential for frozen and broken pipes. title: Worst App Ever!!!!
text:
The Nest App is very unstable. Every time I open it to check the system, change the temperature or schedule, I will first see the current system status on the app screen then it will immediately change prompting me to enter my password. I would go through this nuisance every time I open the app, even though it’s set up to automatically login. When I try to edit the schedule it constantly kicks me out telling me to log in even though I’m currently logged in. I reported it to Nest and nothing has improved. I was advised to delete app and reinstall, and the same thing keeps happening, with numerous installs.

At one point the units would auto schedule, even though that feature on the units and in the app were disabled. This is the worst app ever. If the rating scale contained negative numbers, I would rate this a minus 10 (-10)!

title: Too complicated and doesn’t work the way it should
text:
This app tries to do too much and the resulting product is over complicated with displays that don’t give the needed info without wasteful digging in.
To begin with, the opening screen shows the temps each thermostat is set to, but not the temp that exists in the space. For that - you have to dig in. When you set them on heating, for some spaces it will tell you how long it would take, and for others it won’t.
Thermostats go into “echo” mode with no apparent reason, and then it takes extra steps to get them out of it.
The learning mode works poorly unless you have a very strict, same schedule, I guess, because we don’t and the app couldn’t learn well.
Even the home/away function didn’t work well for us and we had to disable it.

title: Google Sign In Now Makes App Not Work
text: I would give five stars up until you have forced me to sign in with Google. Now the app will not work. System error. I’ve wasted 30 minutes trying to make this work tonight. This app used to work flawlessly. I got an email asking if I wanted to merge with my Google Account and now you have forced it on us and it does not work. In this day and age with constant sign ins and passwords if your going to make people do this could you at least make sure it works first? Does not work on my wife’s phone either. Please give me my old Nest account back (that doesn’t work either).

title: Thermostat Off-line
text: For more than a year, I’ve had the Nest app to control my thermostat. It worked - mostly - fine for the first 60 days. Since then it fails randomly and unexpectedly 50% of the time. That’s a real problem for me because I’m paralyzed and I depend on being able to control the temperature remotely - say, from my bed - when I can’t move. I haven’t changed it yet because of my physical limitations. However, it’s now a priority because it went off-line around 2 AM and it’s now 1:10 PM and it has yet to reconnect, despite deleting the app and reinstalling it, etc. Because of this, I do not recommend the nest thermostat and remote app. It’s more trouble than it’s worth.

title: Almost good but huge issue with playback
text:
The Nest cameras and doorbell themselves are fantastic. The notifications are way faster than any other security cameras we have tried, the image quality is far better, and the app is very responsive. 

Controlling your thermostats is also very simple and intuitive. 

The reason my ranting is so low is because: trying to rewind the security footage and see something that happened at a specific time is frustrating and broken. This is a huge issue for a security system to have. For some reason google thought a “snap” feature in the timeline would be a good idea. When scrubbing through the timeline the play head will “snap” to an event. The issue is that the events always start in the middle of the event and you can just rewind a few seconds to see the beginning of the event. The “snap” feature will keep snapping back to the same place or you have to rewind a few minutes and watch nothing for a while to see the beginning of the event. 

It is super frustrating and makes what would be an easily recommendable product, not recommendable. If google would remove this one “feature” I would give this app 5 stars.

title: Horrible App!  App went from great to terrible
text:
I have had nest thermometer and used the app for several years.. I have  actually recommended this product just because of the easiness of the app.   However here recently it’s seems like everyday the app logs me off, or says the thermostat is offline, or literally in front of my eyes the app flickers between the blue thermometer screen with the blue thermometer (for on) to the “try again” and redirects me to the log in screen.  With in a mater of seconds it’s not uncommon to go back and forth these screens.. 

Nest - when I bought your product your where not affiliated with google.  

I do not believe in big data I believe that as a consumer I have the right to decide who I share my data with.  Please fix these issues on your app as I have no plans to get a google account.  Otherwise i will drop your product!!

title: Great product, setup is nightmare
text: I love the Nest thermostat. I had one In my condo that was already there and it was great. So when I moved, I decided to install a Nest thermostat in my new house. The install process was a nightmare. What google said would take 30 min ended up being an hour and 15 minutes. They didn’t explain in the steps that if you have to cover your old wall markings, that you have to use the face plate. And there is this other plate that comes with it that has no explanation and is not marked so I have no idea if I was supposed to use it or not. Then the screws wouldn’t go in far enough to hold it in place and I had to use a drill even though it said not to. Needless to say, I don’t want to install another one ever again.

title: app is…. kind of pointless.
text: the thermostat itself is an absolute dream. however, trying to control through the app was an absolute nightmare! this app doesnt do that at ALL. nowhere. the only nest appliance we have is the thermostat, which makes “getting them all together” or whatever even more pointless. unfortunately, after many confused internet searches later, i realized that the app didnt even do that. for some reason, the only real thing i can tell this app does is link your device to your account and tell you the temperature outside. oh, and you can set whether it uses your location services to turn the AC on/off. but you cant change the AC manually with this app. you have to use the google home app. so, yay, twice the device storage and twice the hassle, i guess?

title: Overall happy but 1 disappointment
text:
I’ve had my Nest Learning Thermostat for a year now. I love nearly every feature on it with one exception. The schedule feature... Not Auto Scheduling, the actual schedule where I can set it up to run a different temperature at a certain time. There is a simple fix that can but has not been done... Make a button to turn off the feature. 
If you set it for summer months and want to turn it off after the summer, you have to manually delete all of the times from the schedule to do this rather than just clicking on an “on/off” button in the app. 
I’d love to see this button added on an upcoming update.

title: Very disappointed for the price
text:
After installation of the cameras outside and less than 25 feet from my modem/router the transmission quality is extremely unreliable. It constantly freezes and is very unreliable. 

If I get a notification that motion triggered the camera, the delay can be as 30 seconds to over 3 minutes from the trigger until I get actual live feed from the camera. This makes it worthless in the event that it is an intruder. 

Also the history of these events is rendered useless as there is nothing recorded due to the lead time. Whatever triggers the camera is gone by the time it records.

title: It shouldn’t be so hard to add multiple devices
text: I want to say this product is great but adding multiple nest product is garbage. I don’t understand why it is so difficult. I live in a smart house and nest is the only device that has this issue. The thermostats (4) took forever to get all under one home because after you install the first one the set up adds an extra step. The “search for assisting nest product “ step. By some stroke of luck or divine intervention I got all 4 devices installed in one home everything was great. A year later I had an issue with one of the thermostats and replaced it. Now 3 months later it’s impossible to have all my nest product in one home. It seems like they don’t want you to have multiple nest products. Other than that they work great but if you have more than one thermostat don’t bother.

title: Good idea but not well implemented
text:
The app really help but the implementation was below average. I was not able to use it for more in depth understanding of my home environment.  Also I have issues that the protect can not be properly grouped such that the message won’t tricky to all. 

I really had issue with The app when I suddenly experience a likely device failure in early morning. The alarm falsely indicate there was smoke but none. I was not able to turn it off from device since it is high up and need a chair to reach. The app was no help to silence it as the error message came back again and again. 

The biggest problem I had was the app will register phantom alarm even after the protect had been removed from AC, battery removed and taken out of the house.  It is just pure annoying that after all these steps, I still get smoke alarm “now”.  

I really hope that the product dev had a better user experience survey and probably take some from the “old school” dev before them.  This is a real disappointment.  

Now I am waiting community help and if any of the tech support will get back to me. But my guess is, it may take some time before anyone reach out to me.  At worst case I will have to buy replacement units soon.

title: Terrible program
text:
Whoever wrote this thermostat program has never even used a real thermostat. You can’t even set the FAN to ON! You have to set it to HEAT or COOL. Then adjust the fan. STUPID! Then once you actually set the Fan to run for a MAXIMUM of 12 hours, it slowly gets there. title: Control it remotely
text: If you just look at 5 years or beyond that we had no way of controlling the stat remotely from anywhere but now it feels like it’s a normal thing and as far as this nest app and I’m sure nest is one of the earlier WiFi stat that you were able to control stat with your phone or laptop or even just by talking to it I mean how amazing is that and as far as this app it’s very easy to control and very easy to navigate and it literally shows the same thing on the stat screen and able to display it on the app so i really love the app and nest continue to improve the app as well with updates.

title: Be careful schedule settings ignores
text:
Good app,  nice to be able to turn it on when I’m away and also creat schedules. Lately however, i have been noticing that when you create a schedule it will either heighten or lower the temperature that you’ve set.  I came home to an 80 degree house on a 50 degree day. So now i have to close out  of the app and go back in to ensure the app didn’t change the setting that i just set.  More often than not it did and i have to keep going back in and out the app till i see my change took.

I don’t like wasting money and this causes me to waste good heat on beautiful days.

title: Better video controls, please
text:
Overall the Nest Hello system and App are very good.  The ability to customize the area that is monitored for motion is great.  The shortcomings are the clumsiness involved in switching from live view to recorded clips and the lack of good controls when viewing a video clip.  There are controls to fast forward and rewind 15 seconds at a time.  A simple touch-control slider would be much easier and effective.

One other issue- the merging of Nest and Google Home has been somewhat confusing.  There is an option to migrate your Nest products over to Google Home but there was little to no explanation from Nest as to how or why this should be done.  A simple email to current Nest users explaining this would be nice.

title: Me life experience
text: I Purchased a Nest thermostat.  Best purchase ever ...  other than programming. I can turn my heat off ( forced hot air ) over night. Temp holds great. No fuel used all night. Up in am. Click on heat from my iPhone in bed under cover 12 min house toasty . turn off go to work heat off. I turn on just before I leave work. Toasty when get home off again over night no heat on . .  I only run the heat 1/2 hour in 24 I use to top off fuel every mo. I have hade the Nest  2 mo now ,  no heat oil need ...Still have just over 3/4 tank.   2 months  in. Would have used just over 1/2 tank in heat oil with the old technology thermostat .  Love this Nest .   Alex,C

title: Cameras are great, app not so much
text: I’ve have 5 nest cameras at different properties and really like them. However, The phone app continually kicks me out and I constantly have to re-log in.  I bought a new iPhone 11 a few months ago and I thought that would help after several years of the app crashing while reviewing recordings.  I also have several Ring cameras and their app is much more stable, especially when it comes to monitoring several locations.  Nest is great for when you need to record 24/7 but just plan on logging in via web browser if you have issues with the app.

title: Frustratingly poor performance
text: We use the app for two nest cams. First off, it has kicked me off and made me re-sign in twice today. And as usual, I can’t go to a certain spot in the history. When I scroll forward or back it jumps around a few mins forward or back as soon as I stop scrolling. This makes recording way less useful - essentially I can’t go to a specific spot in the recording - I can only get to plus or minus 3 or 4 mins of any particular point in the recorded history. The app is also hugely unreliable. Some days it doesn’t record. Some days the night vision doesn’t work. Some days the connections from the camera to WiFi fail frequently. This app basically is crap. Hard to believe that Google owns it given the poor quality and it says something about where they are headed as a company perhaps.

title: Ruined by Alphabet Inc.
text:
Nest used to be the best smart thermostat then Google bought it. Nearly impossible to predict what it’s going to do. Setting up any kind of manual schedule is clunky at best. I’ve had it set to heat/cool for the spring to keep it in the range I want and it will insert a new range somewhere else during the day that is not cohesive with what I’ve set. I then find myself sweating only to discover it’s systems have decided the temperature range ‘I want’ is somehow now 72 to 75 degrees, not the 68 to 74 I have set it for.

In short, this went from a great product to being just another thing collected by a massive company that made some changes then left it to languish. And now it’s #obnoxious #frustrating #junk #wasteofmoney

title: Nest was great, and then Google happened
text: Seriously, works best in manual mode with no smart features now.  Nest was wonderful and built great products, and then Google came, and made a mess on it.  Easy interface, when it chooses to connect.  Products are smart, when they’re not being incredibly dumb.  Short: when you’re sleeping, your thermostat determines the lack of activity means you mustn’t be at home, ECO MODE!!!  You’re on battery saver or have no cell signal, “I can’t tell if you’re home or not, ECO MODE!!!”  IT solution, factory reset.  Hope they mention to remove all your sensors from your account beforehand, else that’s a 1hr process to let them all reset and another reset, delete app and start all over.  I loved Nest, but then Google made it awful!!  2 stars because on manual it’s really solid.

title: Great function, easy install
text: This hardware haha to be the most intuitive I’ve ever come across. I am no handyman but managed to install first a system with thermostat and smoke detectors (without a single hiccup) and then, more recently, in a different home the Nest Learning Thermostat with remote sensors. We tired of difficulties with our prior hardware on our two systems. They went a bit crazy and were no longer controlling the two systems separately. So we replace just one of the two. Same easy experience as before, same seamless process and flawless performance. I won’t bother considering any other product from now  on.

title: E-Nest  Peace of Mind
text: I have installed 4 units to date in two homes and a 5th on order for Grammas house as well. Installation is a snap and controlling them from my iPhone is actually fun! Setting and modifying a schedule is simple as well. The actual BIGGEST benefit of owning this new technology is KNOWING every morning that the heating systems are functioning properly during the winters in non-occupied homes or spaces! On the phone in just a few seconds you can see EACH ZONE’S set temp and actual temp, a real comfort. Here in the northeast frozen pipes can occur real quickly if a furnace faults with no one there to know it. Peace of mind for me is it’s unadvertised value and benefit. -Dan K

title: Love this camera!
text: Just bought this Nest outdoor camera, it does plug into a 120volt outlet which I love- they said they have discontinued this camera so I hurry and found one at Kohl’s. My sister has had this camera for over a year and i absolutley love the video and notifications to my phone. Very clear picture and you can also hear and talk over the camera! Have no idea why you would discontinue this and go to just battery- if nest wanted to do that they should have it where you could use it either way. But I was sold on the reliability that my sister has had with hers. Great Camera, I am very happy.

title: Return on investment soooo fast!
text: We were conscientious conversation it’s before we installed the nest E units in our 2-zone HVAC system. Even if we’d not had a rebate for installing them, we’d have saved more than the cost of Toth units in less than 18 months. I keep a spreadsheet of our energy costs, both electric and gas, and without being uncomfortable and no additional efforts to weatherproof our 115-yr old home, we continue to save money  on our bills. It’s close to three years now, and we are thrilled with our investment and the reduction in carbon footprint we contribute. And, BTW, I track BTUs of gas, not dollars, so it’s independent of gas costs.

title: Difficult to stream video from cameras
text: Nest cameras are probably one of the most expensive cameras on the market plus a monthly subscription. When you pay so much for a camera you would expect to be able to stream the video smoothly, however, watching previous video shows frame by frame when you’re not on wifi. When your on wifi with wifi speed of (600mbs) the video isn’t too bad, however still takes time to load. Notification shows you of an activity that happens approximately 15 seconds ago so by the time you open the notification there’s no one there and to view the video that was recorded if your not on wifi is hard to do when you’re video shows frame by (slow moving) needs improvement

title: Exponentially inferior to Ring.
text:
I had a Ring doorbell that was broken by debris in a windstorm. Since I have a nest thermostat that I love, I thought I’d consolidate my apps by replacing my ring with a nest. They’re the same right?  No!  Wrong!

The ring app is so much better!  My nest worked correctly for a week. Slightly harder to set up your zones than a ring, but all in all it was fine. Then without a reason, it has just stopped recording video. I can only see a snap shot of an event, no video. No sound. Literally a still picture. Not what I need. Not what I paid for. I can’t find any tech support available on the app. With a ring I only needed tech support once, so I just called them a spoke with a person that helped me. Nothing like that available with nest. 

I’ll be going back to Ring with no regrets. Except that I regret spending my money on a nest doorbell.

title: Easiest DYI system - worth the money
text:
This was easy from the start. I believe it’s worth the money you spend because it was very simple to set up and has worked flawlessly for the past 6 years for us. 

Nest thermostat - very simple and easy to program saved us money right from the start 

Nest indoor and outdoor cams - each camera costs about $100/year for a 10 day retrievable recording that captures 24/7 video even on the darkest nights. It has given us much peace of mind around our property 

Smoke alarms - I used this in my workshop so that I know if there is any sign of dust fire or smoke from anywhere in the shop. It went off a few times with appropriate electrical malfunction. I love the fact that it self checks every day or two and I don’t have to remember if the batteries need replacement. It lets me know automatically. 

Overall - very happy customer and would recommend it for anyone who wants to take their home automation seriously but not pay exorbitant for a custom installation

title: Expensive startup but very good
text: Yes it is expensive for a thermostat, but you get what you pay for. This thermostat and the accompanying app works better now then any time since I've owned it. The thermostat itself has always worked great, but at times the Home/Away assist on the app is peculiar. Espcially if using multiple phones. The best route I found after configuring the app is to download Google Home app and linking the thermostat to it. For some reason when you set up "routines" and set up location with Google Home it also fixes the issues with Home/Away not working well in the Nest App.

title: Tired rating 1 star in app and it freezes.
text: Has anyone else had a bad experience with Nest? I constantly have problems with the one my apartments make me use for my AC and heating.  With that being said, when prompted by the Nest App to rate my experience, I give an honest 1 star. The last few times I have attempted to rate the app at 1 star the prompt freezes, the app shuts down and never submits. This has happened 3 TIMES! I feel as if Nest has an algorithm in place to force quit and or obstruct low start reviews just to keep their almost perfect rating that is displayed in the apple App Store. If anyone else has this issue please keep making it known so they can’t manipulate ratings in hopes to keep them at the top of the game.

title: Overheating 12 Pro Max FAST
text:
This app is the only app on my phone that causes it to overheat REALLY FAST! My phone screen will get very dim very fast in a attempt to cool itself down (even though the brightness is turned all the way up!) and it takes a while to launch now, up to 30 seconds.

title: Google ruins everything it touches it seems!
text: Nest cam and the Nest app were wonderful until google came in. I have had more problems with this app since google has been involved. It seems like the longer and more involved google gets with the nest brand the worse it ends up. I constantly get “problem connecting try again” message and errors. It will work for awhile and quit again for no reason. It seems like google wants to strong arm all the users with a nest account to create a google account for it to work correctly and I don’t want to do that! For what they charge for their products and services one would think you would get a flawless system and product with limited aggravations, not so in this case....I would look somewhere else for security cameras that have an app that will work consistently.

title: Design: great! Functionality: terrible.
text: There are so many thing I love about Nest products and the Nest app - design, integration, capability. Sadly, the functionality is just not there. It takes three to five times to connect to the app every time I open it whether I’m in the house or not, which means that it’s not always possible to turn the alarm off in the window between entering the house and the alarm sounding. It takes four to five tries to set the alarm when leaving the house. Every time we are traveling there are chronic offline issues, which does not happen when we are home and is not related to our internet service. We have no other internet or connectivity issues except with Nest. Hopefully the bugs get straightened out sooner rather than later, but the technical features are just not yet up to par.

title: Broken waste of time and total garbage
text: Broken waste of time and total garbage.  Get a scheduled thermostat instead.  Perhaps one that can link to smart devices at most.  At most says I’m away when I’m not in spite of checking every setting and looking at the map location of what is home.  With and without phone location detection.  Turns itself off when it shouldn’t.  So I disabled that.  “Learning” constantly turns off the thermostat when it shouldn’t, no matter how many times I turn it back on.  If I wanted to save energy by never ever running the AC or heat then I would just rip my thermostat out of the wall and toss it in the trash.  So I disabled learning.  “Early on” turned it on several hours too early even when I set it to 1 hour.  So I disabled that.  Now I have a regular dumb thermostat except that it responds to Alexa.  Poorly.

title: Smarter than Your Equipment
text: The nest thermostat saves you money when you are able to control it and it goes by your routine. However, lately mine has been turning it’s auto schedule on it’s own even though I turned it off. I also cleared all previous data. My solution became turn it completely off when I leave the house and turn it on when I am driving home. It has worked and it stopped doing it’s own thing. Now it actually follows my commands and I haven’t had to leave it off theough the day. Don’t be like me and figure it out when you look at your week’s usage to realize it’s been on because it was turning to a higher or lower temperature than you had it set on.

title: Nest Thermostat Error
text: I work in the security business, working with multiple smart home features. Our new product we purchased less than 3 months ago, doesn’t turn on our furnace. We have set schedules in play for each day. The thermostat shows that it sees it, but does not follow the schedule. We have had to repeatedly turn off the furnace and turn it back on for the heat to kick on. We had NO issues before this thermostat. My furnace is brand new. I’ve checked all furnishings for the furnace. Everything is in perfect order. The only good thing that I enjoy about the thermostat is that it has a tech look to it. Other than that, it seems to be useless. I’ve been dealing with the constant issues because I don’t want almost $300 dollars to go to waste...

title: TAKES FOREVER TO CONNECT or signs OFF
text: The experience so far is not great. On the initial install I linked it to my Google account and enabled the location tracking hoping to enjoy the auto away feature. Well, ever since I did that my phone has been running hot and slow. The auto away feature never worked so I disabled the location tracking. Now it takes forever to login and at times it doesn’t login at all. When I finally get signed in by login off/on, what’s the first screen that shows up on the app... If I want to enable the location tracking? NEST no, I don’t want you tracking my location. You should focus on getting a better interface between your app and Google Home. Also, what’s the point of selling additional sensors if they don’t even show up on the Google Home dashboard???? It doesn’t make sense!

title: Zones and notifications unreliable
text: Everything worked for 2 days since i got it, with the nest aware 30 day trial. But after 2 days, the zones and notifications stopped working. Motion/person won’t register in the timeline. The colors of the events are all dimmed and it doesn’t trigger any notifications or even worse - completely missed. Not very helpful at this point without zones working which is the reason i got it. Net, google and nest migration is not working well and causing software bugs/errors. Please fix or need to return this. P.S. this is a wide spread problem reported by many on the web.

title: Nest doorbell still need work

title: great product, mostly user friendly, except for the tedious schedule settings.
text:
My review is actually pretty long,I love my smart thermostat! The app homepage is simple and straightforward. Overall, it is pretty user friendly.

However, the schedule settings need an upgrade because resetting the schedule is very tedious. If you want to clear the schedule, you have to remove each item individually. And you cannot select more than one. There’s no “Clear All” button. It’d be very useful to include a “Clear All” button next to the ”Add” and “Remove” buttons.

Cool trick I just figured out. Two ways to speed up the process of clearing the schedule. Both are Copy/Paste solutions.

1) Clear one day, copy it, Then select a different day and paste. Repeat until the schedule is clear.

2) clear the schedule except for one item. Then hit “Copy Week” (note: deselect the day). Assuming you have more than one Nest thermostat, you go to a different schedule and hit “Paste Week”.

I would recommend the first solution. It’s simpler and faster.

Sorry this review is so long. I hope it was helpful.

title: Hack to fix clip vs history mode for iPhone!
text:
The new iOS ruined the Nest app for me and all I can see is clips instead of the history that I pay dearly for. I called the help line and tried to explain it, but there was an obvious language barrier. I hope Google is reading this, because here is the (temporary) fix!

Clips only and no history on iPhone: all you will see is the vertical lines on top right of your Nest cam view and only the clips will appear below. Click the “off” button on your iPhone (for my 2020 iPhone SE, it’s the top right button). When you turn the iPhone back “on” via face or thumb print, the same Nest camera view will reappear but now the horizontal history lines will appear best to the vertical clip lines in the Nest camera view. Click the horizontal lines and you can see the history! You will need to do this same procedure for each camera you’re running. So far, it’s worked for several days for me. 

I updated to the latest Nest version and all my history cameras reverted to clips. I re-did the above hack and the history is working again. This works on an iPhone XR, 2020 SE, and 8+.

This has to be something you can fix, Google.

title: Not for automation
text:
Nest is great if you don’t care what temperature your house is as long as you’re “saving” money.

The good:

It’s digital and wifi connected with an app
It uses geofencing to control temperature when you’re away.

The bad

Nest attempts to “learn” your temperatures by remembering every time your adjust the thermostat.    The problem here is I don’t adjust my thermostat at the same time every day and to the exact same temperature.   So I’m often finding myself at some random time saying why am I so cold? Or so hot?   I go and check the temperature to find out that nest decided I wanted it warmer (or colder) because last Tuesday I set the temperature.   But it then resets it to Wednesday’s temperature the next day (which may be different).
Nest does have a schedule where you can set the temperature but often, if you randomly adjust it for say a party or a dinner with friends nest will yet again decide that this is the preferred temperature at that time so next Friday be prepared to have your heat suddenly turn off ( or the AC)

Overall the device is just over thought.    Temerpature doesn’t need to be this complex.

title: Nest a long way to go with its quality

Cool gadget but quality is low and user experience even lower, but it’s a cool looking gadget and that’s all I can say on the + side compared with WiFi enabled alternatives

title: Doesn’t give you a report of the actual indoor temperatures
text: I’ve had the nest thermostat for about 18 months. I’ve a 3 story home that I’ve insulated as much as possible. title: Drop Cam and Drop Cam Pro
