title: Nest Thermostats and Dot sensor
text:
We recently added air conditioning when we replaced our +22 year old furnace. We have dual zones - upstairs and down - w/ a dot sensor in our master suite which is half the upstairs of the house.

The performance of the system couldn’t be better. We usually just cool the upstairs in the evening, but w/ very hot weather the last few days we have coll our whole house. Having nest thermostats and the nest make it as easy as it could possibly be. We hit “away” when we leave and the system goes into Eco mode and let’s the house warm up a bit, but stay w/ in a predetermined range.

When we are on our way home, we tap on the app and it’s perfect when we get home.

We also have the nest camera watching our back yard, and the nest doorbell.
I also have a nest camera in my 99 year old Dad’s bedroom in his nursing home, so I can see him any/every time I want or need.

We are huge fans!!!

title: Nice, but could be much better.
text:
It’s nice and sleek, but it’s not complete, as most google products.

The interface lacks day and night modes, so some interfaces blind you at night, such as the schedule interface, or the fan schedule interface (bright white at night isn’t good for my eyes).

The temperature sensors’ capability is limited. Only being able to change their priority to a fixed four, who knows what time, schedule, is annoying.

Showing the temperature of the sensors and the thermostat in super small font on the device display list is ridiculous.

If a connection with the thermostat hasn’t been made recently, the interface shouldn’t pretend it’s got recent information. I’ve had it show outdated data while the thermostat reported wildly different info.

The app should do a better job learning from my location to know when I’m coming home from work, to start preconditioning, since I do not have a regular work schedule, so I can’t really set a schedule that’ll actually be accurate.

title: Helpdesk assist was fantastic!
text: We upgraded our Wi-Fi system recently and had trouble reconnecting our nest smoke detectors  so we Requested a callback from the online site. Someone called us back within two minutes. That person stayed on the phone and helped us all the way through until we had everything working. It took over an hour and he was extremely patient the whole time and very nice. It was so wonderfully refreshing to have a good experience with a customer service representative. Two thumbs up!

title: Camera Pro
text:
I love my Nest Cameras but the price and payment options for multiple camera’s video storage is a real problem so I often recommend other brand that include storage fees and/or better payment plans.

Backup power is another item the camera industry needs to over come especially with the PGE PSPS issues.

All in all, the Nest cameras when functioning (power) and not having to pay for storage or horrible plans based on a subscription date (and not the date for each individual camera), are very good cameras.

title: Crap
text: If I could give this no stars I would. I’m gonna write this review for the makers of nest in hopes some lightbulbs come on for them. When designing a thermostat, I would highly recommend one that actually regulates the temperature in the area it’s supposed to. If a person sets their desired temp for say 71 degrees, that’s not a suggestion for your “smart” thermostat, that’s the temp the person would like the room. 75, 77, 81...those are not the desired temps then why does your product consistently allow, and they do nothing about, the room reaching those temps? I think I have an answer, it’s because it’s cheap crap. The thermostat at my office is probably 20 years old and has 0 issues regulating a temperature. Nothing about this equipment is convenient, helpful, or easy to use. AVOID AT ALL COST.

title: Google Ruined Nest
text: Have been a big fan of Nest products and the app for years. Then comes along Google. Ever since then the app is a total headache to work and the IQ cameras go down to the grey screen of death every once and a while. Say, like if you were traveling for the recent holidays and now you can no longer keep an eye on your house. The good news is that it was relatively easy to fix. Just unplug and plug back in. That is great if I was home. Well the folks at Google had a great solution you should hook them up to a smart outlet! Seriously?!? Unfortunately I am too deep in at this point with hardware and don’t want to abandon it. Seriously, if you have not purchased hardware yet look at other options as the app has been nothing but a headache for the past few months.

title: Nest better then the rest
text: We use Nest, Wyze, Ring and Samsung. We preferred Nest because it was easier to use. Not as complicated. The alerts are quicker to get to me and are quicker to look up. We spend more on the cameras and services but it is a better value. The history look up is way faster to pull up than the other two brands. My mail person is fast and sometimes doesn’t alert the ring door bell but the Nest camera is alerted. The Ring door bell has auto reply which is nice. The system is more stable with Nest.

title: It isn’t working!
text: Although it worked perfectly and without issue for a year and a half, the thermostat has only come on intermittently for a month. The coldest month we’ve had in years (Colorado); minus 10 degrees F. That is bad enough but the tech support is completely useless. I’ve talked to them for a total of 12 hours and it still isn’t working. They said it’s out of warranty so wouldn’t send me a new one and don’t seem to know what to do since they’re just working off of a checklist in India. Are they okay with me freezing to death or my pipes bursting? It seems like they don’t care. I’m beyond frustrated and it’s actually making me depressed. I feel like they know the problem but don’t want to say.

title: Horrible design of the application
text:
The design of the application is horrible! It is so confusing to work. Here is a small list of things that are wrong with it (at this brief moment):
1) It is confusing as to how to view your other Nest Cameras from being on a certain feed. 
2) When you drop the video event timeline log the camera automatically zooms in to the center of the current view. 
3) The two-way talk feature on the camera is not fluid. It is all-too-often that I have to instruct people to wait to talk until 2-5 seconds after I am done talking (from the camera) so that I can hear everything they say. 
4) The notification from when an event happens to when I get notified is horrible. So much can happen in that lost time.

title: Glitchy system
text:
I chose to make my entire house a nest system all at once. I have two locks, 4 hubs, a doorbell, two thermostats and a camera. 
It’s glitchy shuts down without warning and, stops working at random. 

One of the locks is completely broken and doesn’t work at all anymore. We use the back door. The camera steams properly only 50% of the time (we use it as a monitor so this is incredibly frustrating) and one of the hubs refuses to play music. The other 3 will sometimes only play the first ten seconds of a song and then stall. The thermostat times don’t work properly to turn on and off and different schedules times.  I’ve reset them all, what feels like, 1000 times.

title: 21st Century Temperature Control
text: We have had our Nest thermostat for several years and the features I like best are: 1.) access to every function on a smart phone. 2.)When on a multi day trip I can start heating the house several hours before we arrive home. Before, we would get home and have to wait several hours for the tempera ture get up to or down to a comfort level in the winter or summer. 3.) It reminds me when to change the furnace filter. There are any other features I like, but the above are the top 3.

title: Amazing
text: Cameras doorbell alarm thermostat the entire system is amazing. The app can lag but by far overall over the ring cams and systems. Picture quality is better the app is user friendly I love the nest system I add more every year. The only complaints is the occasional app lag or the home away assist not always functioning as it should. Home away works then it doesn’t. Newest issue keeps saying there’s activity in the house when there hasn’t been anyone there all day set to away check back and find the heats been running full blast saying activity. Hard to save energy and money when the app is always messed up

title: Loving it and enjoying it
text: Love my nest!! Been having it over a year and never once have i had problems with the nest or the app. Clear and straightforward is another reason i love it. It learns your activity and runs only when it NEEDS to run and not running using up power when it’s not needed. It took about a 2 months when i started to notice a change in my bill but as it tunes in on your activity it saves you money. Use all the features and i promise that you will get the best results. Best choice!!

title: Great video quality but the app is SO GLITCHY
text: I had a Ring before this, and the video quality and various features are SO much better with Nest.  Everything runs smoothly in the background... until I open the app.  The app freezes EVERY TIME I try to use it, making it impossible for me to speak to someone at my front door, or even view who is ringing the doorbell.  All I can do is open the app and see 2-3 seconds of the person standing there, and then the whole thing freezes, the video is paused, and I can’t navigate around the app. Our Google Hub shows the video just fine, but the iPhone app is essentially useless.

title: Great Lock
text: This lock is amazing. I’ve been wanting one with a remote to lock and unlock the door for a long time. I have someone who comes by everyday to drop off something and it is so convenient to unlock the door from my bedroom if I’m not ready to get up yet and lock it after they leave. I have mobility issues and it saves me a lot of steps. There are other good features about the lock too. I would definitely recommend it to anyone but especially those with mobility issues.

title: Needs more integration with iOS
text:
I’d love to give more stars but with Nest not supporting key iOS technologies, the app and service put the burden on the user instead of doing a great job of integrating into their lives. To make Nest a great connected device on iOS, we need:

1)HomeKit integration - this is just tablestakes for a connected home device. Apple has made it even easier for developers to integrate and I want to use the Home app to control all of my devices. Now, I have to use the separate Nest and Google Home apps, which are poorly built and don’t integrate with all of my home setup
2) Siri integration - goes with the above, but again available as separate technology to enable users to better control their environment, especially those who rely on other Siri controlled devices to help them
3) Apple Watch app - again, not hard to build and a Watch app would be terrific to easily set temperature or change HVAC modes

Please, please, please commit to better support on iOS to make the Nest devices a standout choice!

title: What happened recently?
text: The app is great at notifying me with the parameters I set.  Over the last 3 months it’s takes almost a full minute to load but what worse than that is I can’t view my playback anymore.  The app simply doesn’t play, no buffering signs either.   It has no problem going live however.   I’ve reinstalled the app and so continue with the same problem that’s been consistent with 3 different IPhones.   iPhone X, iPhone 11, and iPhone 12.   Unfortunately if this issue persists, I’ll have no choice other than to go to the competition.   This has been a great app and I really don’t want to change.

title: Update
text: There was an update at some point recently to either Nest or my Apple Watch and it won’t allow me to play the motion video clips on my watch anymore. That is probably my only complaint but I do find it pretty inconvenient and the only reason why I am giving 4 stars instead of 5. I have had the cameras for over a year now and love them. I chose these over the ring to have the ability to review all footage 24/7 and not just motion. I am hoping Nest will come out with a spotlight camera and update so motion clips are able to be viewed on my watch again.

title: Nothing but trouble lately
text: I don’t know whether it was a recent update or what it is but my Nest is not staying programmed and functioning the way it used to. I have it set for heat-cool as it’s winter in Florida and temperatures vary. It is not maintaining the temperatures that I have set it for. Quite frustrating. I mentioned it to my neighbor and he is having the same issue with his thermostat. It isn’t holding the temperature we select, it seems to sense you aren’t moving so it changes the temperature. I work from home and sit at a desk with minimal movement and then I wonder why I’m too hot or too cold. I don’t like it; am thinking about looking for another programmable thermostat

title: Bring back Nest App with Apple Watch
text: I use my Apple Watch 24/7 so I don’t carry around my phone.  The Nest app used to have Apple Watch app so I never had to get out of bed to change the thermostat and it had third party apps that allowed me to live stream my cameras. I mistakenly changed over to my google account because my notifications took forever to receive and I thought it would help. Well my notifications are a little closer to real-time at the expense of the convenience of having it on my watch. I have been a nest customer since the beginning but I am seriously thinking there are better options out there now.

title: Wish it was better
text: This app is terrible. The cameras produce a high quality and sharp image i like that part.  Why is it that when I need to view the camera through the app when the doorbell rings, it takes forever to load up??? It’s not the WiFi and it isn’t my cell data. Also, why hasn’t this been faceid enabled yet for iPhone? If I can’t log in through the app it reverts to google home and then I have to click a bunch of buttons to get back to my home page. It’s annoying. Incorporate a hold temp feature for the thermostat too. I work nights and wake up in a sweat because my thermostat wants to be in ECO mode in the summer…in Florida. There are cheaper alternatives to cameras yes with faster load times, but I want to give my nest a chance.

title: Only one schedule available
text: I am pretty happy with the Nest and app for heating and cooling our house. With crazy schedules it’s hard to get a schedule that works. One issue is that you can only set one schedule, and it’s either for hearing or cooling, not both. I just don’t want extremes for either heating or cooling, but heating is dominant in our northerly climate so that’s how our schedule temps are oriented. I found that during the summer the AC was always blasting right before bed. It was the schedule making the nightly change, not a family member! So I’ll have to adjust it every season or just turn off the schedule until winter.

title: Shocking how crappy
text:
If you are intending on using a remote temperature sensor, save your money and don’t buy this junk. You can only schedule the 2nd sensor over 4 time blocks that are preprogrammed by nest and you cannot change. It is so stupid, I probably sound like a boomer that can’t figure out how to use Facebook, but it is true. 

This thing will often be below the temp the a/c is set to and it will still be running and will say “in 10 minutes” as if it still has more cooling to do. 

The app constantly logs me out of the app and requires me to sign back into my Google account and then Google security emails me to tell me that someone logged into my account. Yes, it’s true. For a thermostat, it probably has way too much access to my life. Way too much overkill for something that can barely control the temp in my house. 

If you use Alexa, you can’t instruct it to turn the fan on for a period of time and you can’t ask it to use the second temperature sensor. 

If this was a prototype it would be cool. As a product sold at a retail price, I would be embarrassed if I was part of the team that developed this joke.

title: User interface is too cluttered
text:
Why can’t you software guys make the user interface simple and easy to use? The first thing the user wants to do is go into the thermostat. Put that at the top, not at the bottom of the page. I could only find it when I looked all the way at the bottom called “Hallway.” Why does Hallway have to be at the very bottom of the page? Why?
Take a cue from Apple‘s iOS user interface. It’s clean and simple. And yes, even though this is a learning thermostat, being able to program it manually is a nightmare. And lastly, for some reason, I cannot get the Farsight function to turn on; the option is locked out. So this means the unit is dark when I’m sitting across the room. What’s the room temperature Google?

title: I wanted to like it
text: I love the idea and the design.  Everything seems to be pretty intuitive and easy to figure out.  None of that matters, however, because the app constantly crashes.   It will never stay open more than 5-10 seconds.  The only way for me to actually view my camera is when I log in using a laptop...which means I have to be at home to see anything.  It is crazy that I can’t check a camera I got for security unless I’m at home.  It also means the features like two-way communication are useless.   Check out the community discussions for troubleshooting to see the real problems with this app.  I wish I had before I bought the camera.

title: Scheduling on app is buggy
text: I wish Nest would stabilize their app interface a little better. Trying to set a schedule after resetting our thermostats is a pain because you’ll set the times/temps for a day, back out to copy that day across the week, and you’ll come back later to find temps and times completely changed. And that’s with auto-schedule turned OFF. It’s like the app is trying to sync a little too quickly so it’s registering settings as you’re scrolling the temp up or down, instead of waiting to sync the setting a few seconds after you’ve lifted your finger from the screen.

title: Not what it used to be
text: I was an early adopter and quickly purchased the Protect, Thermostat, and two Nest Cams.  Through the “works with Nest” connections and third party apps I had a wonderful set up that made changes based on geofence settings and native Nest schedules. Everything just worked beautifully.  However, Nest slowly banned third party connections and ultimately killed the “works with Nest” program while simultaneously configuring their app in a way that requires a lot of manual setting changes as you come and go, rather than setting and forgetting.  It’s made the app and products just like any other non-connected device and has made any smart features defunct.  I will not be adding to my Nest devices and will rather be transitioning to another platform.

title: Good Equipment, Bad App.
text: I love the Nest thermostat and it’s convenience. Nevertheless the mobile app is very unreliable. My connection to the app is spotty. It takes too long to connect and often shuts down after it does. It is not a question of my own equipment because it is the only app I have that behaves that way. It all started after I overpaid for a Nest camera. Because I have three separate locations where I have Nest thermostats, including my office but the camera is at only at my home, it should not be the fault of the camera.

title: Missing small features
text:
This is not my first smart thermostat. Some features I miss from prior apps are being able to see what the actual temperature is in a room quickly. Instead I can only see what the temp is set to and a line that’s marginally higher or lower than the set temp. The current temp should be able to be shown at a glance. 

Another feature missing is even simpler. I should be able to swipe from one thermostat to another. Instead you must swipe back to the main page and then select the next thermostat. For efficiency I’d like to be able to go into one thermostat and swipe to the next one.

title: Cameras keep on disconnecting
text: I purchased several nest outdoor cameras. All but one keep on disconnecting. The most frustrating time this happened was when I was on vacation. What made this situation even more frustrating was when I requested assistance using the chat option, I was informed that there was nothing the nest technician could do because I had to be physically present with the cameras in order for tech to troubleshoot. While I understand this is a limitation of the system, I am disappointed in the frequency at which this happens. Additional troubleshooting has not fixed this issue. (side note: in order to post this review, I have to put in a unique nickname. “Disappointed customer” and “Another disappointed customer” are already taken)

title: Easy setup a kid could do it.
text: I just received the Nest and our family loves it. My 13 year old was so excited about it she unboxed it herself and started installing it. With my help turning off the electricity during installation it was a breeze and she pretty much did it all. After installation it was easy to download the app and was up and working in minutes. Alexa was immediately linked up and we can tell her the temp we need from every room. I also love the ease of use controlling the temperature while I’m home or away.

title: Frustration
text: I love this app, however, when I first got the thermostat, I found it extremely frustrating to figure out how to get it to stop regulating the heat/cool automatically. I’m retired & in & out at all different times...every day. I wanted to be able to control the thermostat from my phone when I went out & forgot to change the temperature or whenever I’m home. I sure didn’t want it running when I’m not home, just because I was home another day & had it running. Thank you You Tube- what a lot of frustration. Others had the same issues.

title: Nest app features no longer working after Google bought
text: The Nest app and dropcam worked great before Google. Something happened and certain Nest features were either removed or broken by Google. For example, you can no longer save a clip from the app. You have to go to the website, log in, find the clip, save it. Also, it won’t let you select the length Luke the Nest app did. You just save clip and it automatically pics some length, 1 minute? Let me select my exact clip from the app, start and stop time, then save it. I’m hoping this is improved very soon. I miss you, Real Nest app.  Test in your users next time.

title: Great Concept but missing simple things
text: Love the interface and setup.  However, there are some trivial settings that should be updated.  The Home/Away Assist does not work consistently and if you are Away with auto Eco temperatures set, the assigned schedule should turn on the designated times.  However, it doesn’t and stays in Eco mode because you cannot use both features together.  The schedule will not resume until you manually set to Home or arrive Home.  The whole point of schedules is so that you don’t come home to a cold house that needs to warm up.

title: Very little use to this unless you want expensive subscription
text:
The Nest camera is a Ring for those people who do not want a Ring. The camera is decent. But unless you want to purchase an expensive subscription it is pretty worthless. 

You can do much better much cheaper by purchasing a good camera system and using a dedicated hard drive with software on it. No subscription, no unhelpful customer service and no expensive subscription once you pay for the system it is yours.

title: Useful but glitchy
text:
I like being able to control the thermostat from my phone, but the learning feature was not able to figure out how to adjust for seasonal weather changes so we turned that off

The MOST frustrating thing was trying to set a manual schedule. The app lets you set a schedule for a given weekday. So I set a schedule of temps for Monday. I copied and pasted into Tuesday and several of the temps changed themselves (on both Monday and Tuesday). So my 68° setting for 5am changed to 82° all on its own. Very bizarre and very frustrating. Google/Nest should be able to figure out bugs like this before updating the software.

title: Long time Nest Camera user
text: I’ve had these in multiple buildings in several states. I can see if I’m interrupting before calling or texting and tell if there’s someone I actually want to just say hi to. The resolution is fine on several iPhones and I only have one complaint. Why did Google, upon co-branding Nest, feel the need to keep the dozy looking little green led light on 24/7? It’s intrusive and a dead giveaway. S t u p i d. Particularly if it’s used for after hours or night backup for an ADT or similar serious alarm system. Why oh why Mr. Google?! Asking for your actual users. Hello?

title: Thanks for NOTHING Nest/Google!
text: You buy all their products, spend thousands of dollars and  they make you switch from nest to google migration and kill all the Apple TV support without warning you and they force you to migrate to have necessary features going forward.   I use your products and spent my money with you!! Google weakens my experience and you give your company a black eye by limiting where you customers can utilize your products. Your only harming yourself, not apple.  You making your customers mad and disappointed by robbing them of features and functionality they had before and were part of the reason they purchased your products in the first place!!  Disappointed and betrayed by Google/Nest!  Buyer beware!

title: Thermostat controls HVAC, but app is lacking common sense
text:
The thermostat controls all my HVAC equipment. The app has basic features, but lacks anything more than a bit over basic. 

Learning works, but who really wants a thermostat working to make you less comfortable today based on yesterday’s inputs. Basically if it is 10 deg cooler today than yesterday, I want to bump it up a degree once or twice a day, but I don’t want that permanently..because today will be normal or hotter, most likely. So, turned off learning.

Vacation settings? None

Efficiency settings, yes, but will likely kill pets/plants....so, turned off. Can I adjust efficiency setting to get some gain, but sustain life? No.

More than 6 settings a day....yes, but slows app function horridly.

All I want are like 4-6 settings a day, adjustable increase/decrease for abnormal seasonal high/low outdoor temps, vacation mode, more adjustment on away from home modes, better high humidity control (fan or a/c to dry)....contact me, I’ll write you a use case document!

title: Quirks, funky quirks
text:
Nest thermostat has quirks, funky quirks that makes it more difficult to use.  I don’t like it and when they finally fail on me, I will not purchase another nest product...
I think google is too big to make anything work well, including your droid phones.  And your big brother information gathering is dangerous.  I’ve lived long enough to know that just because a firm is big, doesn’t mean it’s the best or even good.  You are a monopoly, period...!!!
Not good for real competition!
I hope this helps in your endeavor to control the world.  Ad words is a perfect example of how google has hijacked what was supposed to be a free internet and a level playing field for businesses...

title: Landlord controlled
text: As a tenant having this installed with the landlord controlling the temperature is a major problem. I understand that they want to save on costs long term. During the summer it was decent since most people like to have it cooler then, now during the winter, it’s so frigid cold because if I attempt to turn the heat up it won’t. I have it connected to my wifi still doesn’t work. I have even tried using this app and it crashes every time I try to use it. My daughter has downloaded the app on her  new iPhone 12 and it crashes for her as well. When I learned that the landlord controlled the temperature I was beyond ticked off. I’m looking for a different place to stay now. I would not recommend this product to anyone.

title: Worse than a dumb thermostat and dumber than a smart thermostat
text:
Nest API is closed source so no integration with Apples HomeKit. But more critically the app makes lots of poor assumptions, so I turn off the learning features. The app takes a real long time to load and I don’t like the wait, could just go over and adjust temperature quicker.

Setting a schedule is lots of tedious work and its hard to select time, touch interface is harder than just putting times in. Also when I put times in and close it, the temperature often gets corrupted. Why has the AC not run today? It saved cool to 92 instead of cool to 74, and now I have to redo the entire schedule one item at a time.

Buy an Ecobee.

title: Too little information available in your app
text:
I am very disappointed with this NEST thermostat. The message System does not trigger an alert that will  inform me that the house temp is not at target.  The problem is that you have to go into the app and look at it to get the message.  Also the section that tells you that the temp is not at goal does not have a date and time.  How long has my heating system been down?   No help from your app.  Also the temp on the dial is not the actual house temp but the target temp. So In order to  see what the house temp is, again you have to open the app.
No one at google has been able to help me with these concerns.  If someone at google would help solve these problems for me I would be more impressed.

title: Slow Slow  Horrible Service server issues are the newest debacle
text:
App can take up to 20 seconds to open. No doubt Google is gathering information.  I regret that Nest sold its customers out and I am stuck with my purchase. Don't be a fool and buy anything from Nest/ Google their mobile app is marginal and main frame computer is even worse.  Multiple times it looses your account info so you have resign back in.  Both have frequent " offline" issues and server problems are getting to be more frequent.

Latest upgrade is generating “cannot connect to server try again later” quite frequently.

title: Saved my mother
text: I installed the nest protect at my parents house along with the app on my phone. About a week ago I received an alert on my phone that The carbon monoxide levels were high at my parents house. I  Immediately called my mother to see if she was home I had no answer. So I called the fire department they responded and she was home they took her outside and they checked the entire house with there meters and told me the readings were high and if I didn’t call she would have been in trouble. Thank you Nest!!!!

title: Safe and sound
text:
We originally got the nest for the Co2 detectors and smoke alarms. After being so happy with them and learning  about the cameras we decided to get them as well, to see what the dog was up to during the day. This led to the dog being able to retire from his full time position as  head of security, as we no longer required his services for protection. The nest provides us with all the security and piece of mind we need.  I’m also pleased to report that the dog is enjoying his retirement and thanks you as well.
The Linsner’s

title: Continuous problems
text:
My Nest thermostat has turned into a nightmare after a couple years. Now it has a mind of its own. It doesn’t follow the preset schedule or heat properly. As I write this, the furnace is turning off and on numerous times. 

I tried calling at 11am central time, and get a message to call back during regular business hours. They never say what their “regular business hours” are.   When I try online support, I keep getting routed to online forums instead of chatting with a live person. In viewing the forums, I see dozens of people with the same problem for at least two years. 

It got so bad that I reset the thermostat completely and deleted the app and added it again. I spent an hour redoing the setup. It seemed to fix the problem for two days. Now it is back to the same stuff. It says it is heating and the furnace is off. After hours and hours of trying to fix it, I am ready to throw it in the garbage and hesitant to buy any other Google products due to a lack of customer service. 

Maybe if someone at Google reads this, they can have a real person contact me.

title: Are Gen 3 thermostats a step down from Gen 2?
text:
I installed Nest thermostats in my last house and absolutely loved them. Eco option worked great in the Texas summer, my schedule was implemented about a week after install, all was good.

I moved earlier this year and installed the newest version, and I'm pretty frustrated. My thermostats only go on Eco mode when I manually change in the app, despite both my husband and I having home away assist on and both leaving for work and returning home at similar times every weekday. My schedule- once I manually set Eco to on or off- is great, but help in managing pricey power bills in the heat of Austin summer (and random winter cold snaps) were big drivers in my repurchase.

Did something change that's impacting my experience??

title: Simplifies life
text: We have 4 Nest thermostats, 3 in a large house with 3 independent heating/cooling zones and 1 in a vacation house with 1 heating zone. To us, the systems are invaluable in monitoring temperatures from afar, and in  activating and turning down the heating/cooling systems when we move from one house to the other, so that when we arrive temperatures are suitable. In addition, Nest provides an indirect way of knowing whether our wifi systems are running when we're away. Nest is worth the investment based on quality, convenience, and peace of mind.

title: Event Based Recording is totally unreliable!

title: Nest Is The Best

title: Ecobee Is Better
text: The Nest doesn’t make any sense to me. If I set the temp to 70’ it stays there until I change it, or until the Nest decides it’s time to take over and change in to whatever setting it wants from what it has “learned” from my habits. title: Less easy to use than 5 years ago
text:
I like the camera    But due to software “improvements “ it is now harder to just get live stream showing my dogs in their room, with sound and video.  I must struggle with navigating past clips that are recorded every time a dog moves, barks or drinks water.   I just want a “nanny cam”!

title: Nest Hello is GREAT!
text:
I’ve been enjoying my Hello Doorbell. Night vision is crazy good. You can see ppl walking by no where near the front door. No one can take packages off your door step with this installed. It’s been a dream come true. 

There IS A MONTHLY PURCHASE associated with it for “face recognition” and “daily logs” but it’s still worth it’s weight in gold just to see ppl arriving to your door in real time with such clarity. It also comes with decals to display for security if anyone needs them. Super easy to install and I highly recommend it. Cheers!

title: Annoying and unresponsive at times
text: I’ve been using the app for quite some time now and if you don’t have a super fast internet connection, setting the temp can be unresponsive and frustrating. The AC will remain on and take minutes before it responds to the new temp settings. Also the app always logs you out and you have to re-authorize your google account each time. It’s very frustrating especially if you need to change the temp at like 3 in the morning. I would expect more from Google and Nest for the level of technology that’s supposedly in the device. Even now as I am writing this review in “notes” because the review form is writing blank characters. It’s time to get these bugs under control.

title: Razzle Ford
text:
With many devices, feedback is mandatory. I do not want feedback from the device I simply wanted to execute the instruction. Google provides virtually no support for this product. The devices are easily confused by similar words. Fans should be in the product mix but don’t seem to be there yet. When the device gets confused, it is program to give you an instruction. This clearly waste the time of the user who may be changing the instruction while they must listen to one.
Some of the routines just don’t work.
The system is so bad that it requires a nickname to write a review and no nicknames are available.

title: No Hold Function
text:
A basic function for any thermostat is to set a temperature and HOLD at that temperature until you choose to release it and revert back to the Schedule. Why this function is not available is a mystery to me. I tried Nest Help chat with no success. 
Why is this useful? I have a guest bedroom on the first floor. When there is no guest during cold weather I set the thermostat to warm up in the am for breakfast, cool down an hour later while away for the day, warm up again for dinner and back down again for the night. When I have a guest I need to keep the temperature at a comfortable temperature 24/7.

title: Nest app
text: Ever since they integrated with google the app and service has gone down hill. Now sometimes you have to tap it multiple times to get the cameras up and running. Also there is a sign in procedure every time I look it up on my computer. I have also tried numerous times to change or fix my password and it never sends me an email of how to update it so I can’t change my WiFi network. Very frustrating for me since I have 4 cameras at my business, 2 at home, and a nest thermostat. I want to add more cameras and another thermostat and also a doorbell but I don’t care for google at all.

title: Comforting
text:
I used to have a device that monitored the temperature and telephoned me if it went below a certain temperature. It was a comfort if I went to a tropical island in February. But now without land lines it’s useless.
Now, with Nest, I can check the temperature in the house from my cell phone wherever I am. I can change the temperature if I’ve been away and I’m coming home. I can set it to go up or down at a certain time. No more coming home to a cold house! It was also very easy to install.

title: Who’s in Charge???
text: More than a device that learns what your personal preferences are when it comes to comfort, it is a device that dictates at which temperature you should be happy with. It always biases to higher temperatures than I am comfortable with in the Summer and lower temperatures than I am comfortable with in the winter. Over time, it finds out what you want via your chosen patterns and then changes them so that you follow its wishes.  I can’t tell you how many times I have woken up and been hot in the summer and all because it chooses a comfort zone beyond what you consistently programmed to be your preference. It is a temperature nazi. It doesn’t follow your preferences, but follows what it deems you need to be comfortable from its perspective. Stay clear of it.

title: Nest Thermostat Rocks

title: Now could never have a home without it
text:

title: Love the WiFi
text: I really like my Nest thermostat, especially because I can adjust it on my phone or computer from anywhere. The learning feature doesn’t function as seamlessly as I’d hoped. It guesses wrong when creating a schedule. I adjust it manually all the time, which I actually don’t mind. The trouble is when it adjusts itself to a temperature I didn’t want. I could just turn off the learning feature and create a schedule, though. Overall, I like it so much more than my previous programmable thermostat.

title: Syncing two sites is tough

title: Not very reliable

text:

title: Great app

title: Setting Up Devices Has a Major Flaw
text:
This app is pretty good once you get the devices set up.

Sometimes, however, it makes it impossible to set up more than one device. I set up my doorbell without incident. Then, when I tried to set up my thermostat, the app INSISTED on getting the Wi-Fi setup information from the doorbell — even though I had already set up the thermostat’s Wi-Fi manually — failing because it said the devices were too far apart. It was using Bluetooth for this. How am I supposed to “correct” that?

I tried reversing the process — deleting both devices, then adding the thermostat first and then the doorbell. Whew! For some reason, adding them in that order worked. This is a perfectly horrible software design, depending on one device outside the house to link by Bluetooth to one inside — and perhaps on the other side of the house. You can’t move either one, so you’re out of luck in this situation.

But if you can get everything set up, as I say, it’s a good app.

title: Bad News Since Google Took Over
text:
Pre-Google days, my Nest system worked pretty well without much issue. Almost no complaints, about half dozen cameras, locks, smoke alarms, etc.

Once Google came on board (and honestly, I have nothing against Google, just my observation here), did whatever they did behind the scenes (“updates”, “upgrades”, etc.) there have been FAR more issues.

My app periodically (once a week-ish) signs me out. That’s not a huge issue, just annoying.

The app will sometimes think I’m away when I’m home, so my cameras are on when I don’t want them to be, or vice verse (I’m not home, it says I am and disables the camera). And yes, I’ve verified what products detect when I’m home and adjusted accordingly - same issue happens.

Or, the app will recognize I’m home and still keep my cameras on or, again, vice versa (know I’m away, turn my cameras off).

So, to summarize: it’s simply not working a lot of the time.

It’s weird, and a little sad, that a product that worked fine before (and gave me what I pay for) took three steps back.

text:

I’ve called support 5 times and they literally can’t even understand why that’s a problem.

Google has also been dragging its feet on HomeKit support. I’ve come to except they are too arrogant or lazy to ever support HomeKit so I’ve chosen to start a slow migration away from Nest. They add a new useless feature about once a month when they could put their time into features that add value to their platform.

Google has absolutely ruined Nest. Such a shame.

title: Nest is a must have
text:
I have a Nest thermostat for my home. I love being able to wake up to heat, because Nest knows what time I would wake up and turn on the heat. Nest learned my habits.

I have Nest in my tenant’s apartment. My tenants pay their own heating expenses. However, my tenants like calling me when they are away on vacation to turn up the heat when they are returning from their vacation.

They like the idea of the landlord turning up their heat without entering their apartment.

As a landlord, I like knowing if my tenants are keeping their apartment adequately heated to keep the plumbing safe during harsh winters.

My daughter followed my lead and invested in a Nest for her home. She has three small children and enjoys turning up the heat before returning home from work or outings.

Nest is the way to go. I’ll be investing in more Nest products!

title: It’s okay
text: I’ve always had way too much faith in the Nest Cam (indoor version). We have used it as a baby cam for almost 3 years. I liked it a lot more before it was acquired by Google. Mine has had a lot of outages since then, and it’s honestly so frustrating to me that I can’t manage “Nest Aware” from the app on my phone. I haven’t paid for the service in a year simply because it can’t be managed from my phone, while I truly would have. I feel like for $300, you could do better. I’ve had other no-name cameras that worked the same for about $75.

title: Keeps signing me out
text: For the most part, I like the Nest App, when it works. This app is constantly logging me out. When you are logged out, you cannot access Nest from your phone. Logging back in isn’t that much of a hassle ( unless you don’t know your password, in which case it does not give you any options to reset your password.) But I find it to be quite annoying how often it logs me out of the app ( between 2 to 3 times a week.) I feel like it defeats the purpose of being able to change the thermostat on your phone if you can’t access the app and have to get up to do it anyways.

title: Nest Secure
text: System is relatively easy to setup and interface is good. However, I’m disappointed in the lack of customization. In particular the inability to have text notification when someone arrives at the house or a door or window is opened while in alarm mode.  This is an important feature, one most other systems have.   I believe this needs to be addressed right away or I will be looking at replacing with a different system.

title: App needs updating
text: The nest app has always been slow to connect live - folks in the porch have often walked away before I could get the chance to speak with them. But the most recent updates had rendered this completely impossible. We have FiOS internet but whether I’m on WiFi or data service, the result is the same. I had hoped subsequent updates to the app would correct this but this the ability to talk live through the cameras remains completely unusable for now. Please consider making this connection quicker and reliable.

title: Amazing product
text: We use NEST in two short term rental homes in Florida.  The thermostats paid for themselves within about 2 months.  Love the remote monitoring and control - I can make sure the HVAC is working before guests arrive and lock the temperature range while they are staying in the homes.  Service was  amazing when we installed - my husband had a few questions and tech support walked him right thru the process. Best investment we have made in our rental homes!

title: Nest Thermostats
text: I love my 2 nest cameras and doorbell. They are “steady eddies” and always on line. If by chance there is an electrical outage they get back up and running when the power goes on. I wish I could say the same for the e-Learning and 3rd generation thermostats. They are a nightmare and are not reliable to stay connected to the internet no matter what I do. It’s so disappointing when you can’t access them while away from the house. I am really looking into other internet based thermostats that can be reliable.

title: Best way to save!
text: I live being able to control all the thermostats in our home and be able to watch what’s going on through the doorbell camera! Our energy use has gone down dramatically and saving about $100/ month! The best setting is the Nests going into eco mode when there’s no activity in those zones. I highly recommend this system to all homeowners who want to save money and have the controls at your fingertips!

title: Awful just awful
text:
The cameras go offline for no reason, at no consistent time so I can’t blame the problem on power surges or sun flares, they just go offline, inconveniently, like when I’m away or between 11:00pm-6:30am when I’m asleep.

Trust me I’ve checked my internet connection. Easy enough to do when I realize I haven’t heard a Nest notification for hours but the TV set’s been on all day! I’d tell my family to turn the TV off but I’m afraid Nest might hear me and think I’m yelling at it!

Worst of all; the website. Try to log in to your account. Go ahead, try! Every time we’ve tried, we’ve had to update our password. And we can’t sign in with Google because  it sends us back to Nest. But we can’t sign in with Nest because it doesn’t recognize our password!!

At this point we’re ready to call Dish and say here - take it. I hear a Ring at our door.

On the up side it was cheap. Came free with our Dish service.
Only goes to prove, “you get what you pay for”.

title: Nest requires data entry in a poorly designed input experience
text:
I would like to set a schedule for the nest. I know when we will be comfortable at different temperatures. To input the temperatures and schedule, however, I have to remember to spin a dial at different times of day or set an alarm to open the app and “teach” it my schedule. 

I would rather “teach” it my schedule by… inputting the schedule I want. But this basic function- a good experience for scheduling set points - is absent or buried. So I just turned it off, defeating the purpose of the purchase. It is now a dumb thermostat.

title: Decreased energy grade from 10/10 to 4/10
text:
The Nest is not recommended by most HVAC companies. I have had three different companies tell me this. I have had 2 other companies inquire about which thermostat I’m using before sending someone out. That question is rooted in the nests flaws. 

This technology is not recommended for people living in houses where the thermostat is located in a hall with low traffic. The reason being, the lack of traffic makes the nest think people are away and the temperature would begin to fluctuate. 

We now use our best as we would a regular thermostat. The main difference being, a $100 Honeywell thermostat offers a true fan feature and scheduling.

title: As much as I like this product
text: I had to takeoff the first star because this item has to be charged instead of having a long lasting battery who wants to get stuck with the thermostat not working on a 20° day and then have to wait two hours for your thermostat to charge before you can adjust your thermostat settings again the second star I had to drop because it’s a smart device but it doesn’t talk third star I dropped because it is still not compatible with Siri The fourth start a draft because you cannot sign back into the device with your phone if the power goes out you can always sign back from the actual device

title: Could be better, where’s the feedback option?
text: This app could be better, where to start. Ok, so I’m running the fan right now but I want to add time to it. I can’t. I have to stop the fan and restart a timer. Why not let me scroll and add minutes with the satisfying vibration feedback and possibly the clicky sound? #2 where is the Apple Watch app so I can increase or decrease the temperature or fan time with my watch dial? The app does what it is intended to do but I expect better from a multimillion billion dollar company? What are your developers doing sitting on their hands?

title: When thermostat goes offline
text: It would be nice if the app would notify you through a notification or push notification when the batteries are low, the thermostat goes offline, or the condensation line is clogged (if shows a wire not connected) so that the problems are addressed.  If you don’t check the app while out of town, you would not know if any of the above happened.  This could have your house at extreme conditions causing freezing in the cold or mold/mildew when it is hot with no AC going.

title: Next app is an epic fail
text: I bought my Nest Ring video door alarm in late November and set it up. The Nest door alarm works great but the app is an epic fail. I understand Google has bought Nest and while I am happy about that, my phone app which allows me to see who is at the door does not work and they is a huge problem. It never opens and opening it through Google is no help. You seriously need to get this fixed or I and I am sure many others will be forced to look for a different product. It does me no good at all to know there is someone at my door or movement at the door if I cannot see who it is or where they are.

title: Home Nest
text: I have an issue with this device losing connection to my network many times throughout the day.  In many cases it does not maintain the temperature steady.  I end up hitting the retry button to reconnect.  This is frustrating.  Overall the product of a good, but not always the best.  I  thinking of trying another brand.  I also do not feel comfortable with Google having access to any information about me.  I bought my Nest before google bought the company.  If I were buying now, the fact that it is google owned, would make me choose another brand period.  Trusting google is not in my vocabulary.

title: Keeps bugging to enable 2-factor and hand over my phone number
text: Every time you launch the app it pops up a full screen prompt to turn on 2-factor authentication. That’s a bit aggressive IMHO but ok. But when you try to set up 2-factor it requires you to use your phone number. Using phone numbers for 2-factor has been proven to be less secure then using a randomized number generation system. Also they shouldn’t have my phone number as that is another way for them to identify who I am.

title: Next review
text:
I love the Nest thermostat and how accurate it is.  Love it that i can change the temp when i am away from home on my iphone.  When i wake up in the morning, i dont have to get up out if bed to turn the heat up.
I can track how many hours a day my air conditioning runs and then it shows a report for the months usuage.

Its easy to operate using the app or manually.  Great value and i would highly recommend it!  You will really love it!

title: Furnace short cycling
text: I’ve had my Nest for 3 years, but ever since Google acquired Nest and became Google Nest, I started experiencing problems. Last month I two separate furnace companies come out to check my only 3 year old unit to tell me nothing wrong to the tune of $260 / visit. Now that I’ve been taking a deeper dive into this matter, I’ve notice that the Thermostat goes offline a tune and falls asleep while temperature are dipping. I’m constantly have to surveillance the app / thermostat.

title: Notifications Becoming Slower and Slower
text:
As time passes and more updates are applied to all my devices, I notice camera notifications are taking longer and longer to be received by every mobile device we have - regardless of the cellular provider or if we’re at home on WiFi.

Of course, the first statement is always, “you have a WiFi issue at home” however I am a network engineer and have had my findings validated - our dual gig service with 5 WAPs through 7,000 sqft is providing spectacular WiFi coverage inside and outside our home - at our gig services are very solid along with UPS backup for modems, routers, WAPs so our infrastructure is deemed quite solid.

So why are notifications getting longer and longer? Are your services becoming overwhelmed due to the number of devices it’s trying to support nationwide?

We’ve turned multiple neighbors onto Nest and they too are reporting similar scenarios so I’m pretty confident it’s not our in-home infrastructure or ISP.

title: Peace of Mind !!!
text:
I have a condo in Florida and I’m 1100 miles away.
That being said Nest learning thermostat has given me a piece of mind I have not had in a while. 
Last year my thermostat broke down and the humidity levels got so high that I had to have the mold remediated. That’s not cheap. With the nest thermostat I can see the Temperature and Humidity 
levels on my phone and control the system from my home up north. I would recommend this thermostat to everyone.

title: Super EZ
text: Super easy and convenient. If this is available, then why stay with the old way?  Love the fact it let me know when someone entered or leaving the house. When you’re away, it makes you feel safe knowing if your door was opened. Then you have the convenience of giving your guest a guest number that can expire on a certain day, like the day your guests leave. I don’t think I can ever go back to a regular lock again.

title: Good Thermostat, Quirky App
text: The thermostats work well and the app has decent functionality but has connectivity issues. Repeatedly we get error messages that the Nest Services can’t be reached and to try again later. Even though it shows it’s connected to the wifi and we have tried reconnecting the thermostat to the network the error will reappear. On its own it will re-establish connectivity on its own and start working again. It may be more of an issue with Nest and not the thermostat. The manner in which you program the schedule could also benefit from some improvement as well.

title: Great camera, better than expected!
text:
I bought the indoor cam a few years ago and love it! I received the video doorbell from my daughter for christmas. They encourage you to get a pro to install it but it took me less than 30 minutes to get it installed and working! 
The picture the video doorbell offers is crisp, clear and much better than I expected. Even the nighttime lectures are amazingly clear!
The notification to my iPhone when it detects a person or movement is almost instantaneously!

My wife and I now feel just a little more safe by adding the doorbell. Well the doorbell and our 12 gauge shotgun!

I was going to buy the other ‘R’ doorbell that was wireless but who wants to bother charging it every so often? 
If you have the wires use them and buy the Nest! You’ll love it!

title: Too good for google
text: The thermostat works as expected. Unfortunately the frustration comes in with Google making arbitrary changes to their service which compromise the way that you’ve used and become a custom to using your thermostat. Google needs to realize that the customer experience is incredibly important and pulling the rug out from customers with regards to specific features or capabilities with third-party products is a big no-no. I will not be buying another nest. I’m sure many of you will do the same especially if you have any aspirations of using third-party smart home products.

title: Pain to schedule
text: I don't understand why of all the ways they could've designed the way to create a schedule, they choose a weird chart that's completely imprecise and you have to magically guess where you're pressing for both date and time. Why not create a more precise method where you ENTER the time and the temperature you want? And why can't you duplicate the schedule for multiple days? Also, why not allow customizable hours for sensor scheduling? Why is it cut off into chunks? I want the temperature to be picked up off the sensor at 8:30am, not 7 and 8pm, not 9. I don't understand these really stupid choices.

title: Extremely easy setup, but Home/Away doesn’t work
text:
The setup is a breeze and the layout is well done.

My biggest gripe is that the HOME/AWAY function will not stop camera notifications.  If you are working in the yard while the app is set to HOME it AWAY, you will get constant notifications.  After playing with settings multiple times, I called the support line.  After about an hour on the phone, the rep eventually told me that they would send me some information over email which would show me how to configure the app to stop the camera notifications.  The link was to the FAQ section on the nest website which I already visited previously.

If you don’t have cameras and need to set this up for people who are not tech savvy, this is a great option.

If you want cameras, the interface on Eufy cameras / app is much better. Plus, you don’t have to pay a subscription to use Eufy cameras.

title: Great until Google
text: Was a wonderful App when it was a Nest  product, when Google bought them it went in the tank. I paid to record the cameras.... quit working and still not recording...it took 3 days to contact customer service,  was told it was their internal  problem.  Worked for a week or so, quit again. Can’t get anyone in cust service that understands English.  Going to switch to Ring I think and sell this junk on eBay.

title: Works as usual for years
text: The equipment and the related software work as expected.  But no improvements from many years for the price we have paid.  Developers can add more features like improvements to FAN scheduling.  Making it 15 min at different times of the day, every alternate hour etc.  Alerts if the system is running too much more than the average can be another.  Hope they listen.

title: Thermostats and doorbells
text:
The app takes a few seconds to load, and seems like an eternity when you’re trying to view whos at the door via the doorbell camera. By the time it loads the video, they are gone.  Otherwise the app is stable and responsive.  
The doorbell footage seems to always record five seconds before theres anyone there and cuts the footage short, so you cannot see the remaining footage of the person or object.

title: Love and hate
text: Love the nest thermostat but the App does not let me use “forgot password” option. It either does not react or says that has sent an e-mail to re-set the password but there is no e-mail (spam folder checked too). I have tried multiple multiple times and the same story every single time. So I have to sign in with my google account where they use my data, and I strongly dislike using that option. I have even try to delete app and install it again.

title: Used to Work better,  could have been improved.  Now they orphaned my hardware
text:
Works fine, but you cannot share one camera with neighbors without sharing em all (I have 4, some indoors with audio I do not necessarily want to share). Work around is to use a 2nd account for cameras you want to share. For some reason, this horrified customer service. Downside is, cannot see all 4 previews on one screen (one account at a time).

Edit
Rediculus to expected users to climb ladders to charge the new cordless models.  One with floodlights (no batt) ‘coming soon’ but v expensive

title: Nest camera only works 1/2 of the time
text: I have Nest protect, doorbell and exterior camera. Nest Protect and doorbell are wonderful.  The outdoor camera only works 1/2 of the time.  I called Nest support and was told it is an internet connection problem although all three devices are close to each other with the camera closest to the router.  Then I was told to take down the camera to run some test on it, since I am 80 years old, that means hiring a handyman at $50/hr to take down the camera for me.  I don’t want to spend that $100 + dollars so the camera remains non working most of the time.  I asked for an replacement but was refused.

title: Love Nest!
text:
I have multi-zone heating/cooling so I have three Nest thermostats in my home.  I love having the ability to change the temperature of my home from my Nest app from anywhere in the world. 

And when I am at home, I love that my Neat thermostats are connected to my Google Home smart hubs.  This gives me the ability to control my Neat thermostats using voice commands.

With the rising cost of electricity, Nest gives me the ability to have some control over that cost!

title: Lag in Cameras in Nest App
text: Oven using this for a while, but over the past several months it has become increasingly frustrating because looking at the camera history in the nest app has become almost impossible. I’ll open it, start browsing and then it will freeze. If I wait for a while it will free back up for a few seconds, then freeze again. I’m not sure what the current situation is or whether other people are having the same problems, but I’d like to see it fix for that in the next release.

title: Eco mode waste energy
text: Their more advanced settings have cost us more money. The smart schedule feature had to be turned off. It would have the air on when we were out of the house. The latest issue is eco mode. Never put setting for it but thanks to eco mode multiple times that we were out of the house for hours the air ran. The worst being a ten our day when we were out of town. It gets frustrating when the app thinks it knows what we want when, it is rarely right. Other than that the app works great.

title: Away vs. Scheduled Temps
text: I used the schedule part of the app to program warmer temps during the day and reduced temps at night to save energy and sleep cooler. This functionality is great, but when I’m away I would like the ‘away’ function to supersede the daily schedule. Last weekend I realized the heat kept kicking up during the day even though I had marked ‘away’, and I wasted a lot of energy. If I’m gone, the app should recognize that and not turn the heat back up according to my regular schedule. This is a definite flaw in the technology that should be fixed.

title: WORST security system and camera software
text:
Constant spinners and waiting, random logouts, videos that won’t load, frustrating lack of settings and basic features. Even on the latest top-end iPhone Pro, this app takes several seconds to load. Not acceptable for any modern app, let alone one where you’re checking security notifications.

Never have I been so disappointed by a Google product. I’ve clearly invested thousands of dollars in the wrong ecosystem. As an app developer myself, this app is a clear testament to dangers of bureaucracy and failure of a team to execute. Someone at Google should clean house at Nest and revitalize this failing app and ecosystem. Sorry, not sorry.

title: Nice, with flaws
text:
Overall, I really like my Nest thermostats and iPhone app. I have 2 of the 3rd Gen and 1 Nest E. They look very nice and I like the options available on the app to save energy. 

The primary flaws I’ve experienced are 

1. The summary display that shows all of the thermostats with their current temperatures doesn’t update in real time. Quite annoying.

2. The humidity reading appears to be very inaccurate. I sometimes use evaporative cooling and knowing the humidity is very important. I bought a separate temperature and humidity device that I believe more because of the national weather information comparison. The Nest is way off, reporting much higher levels. 

I write this review to provide feedback to the developers. Hopefully they will find a way to correct these deficiencies. It really is an excellent product. I’m just looking for superior.

title: Very good, but missing one feature
text:
I’ve had my Nest Thermostat for years now and am very happy with it.  It’s easy to use and I’m confident that it has saved me money.  

There is one basic feature that is missing though.  A temporary temperature hold.  Let’s say I took a day off and will be home all day, which is outside of my normal schedule.  I’d like to hold the temp as is (disregard the normal programming) for the day.  It’d be good to have a hold until I release and a hold for a certain number of hours feature.
